Francisca has had her business for three years. She is able to help provide for her family's needs through her income. Francisca works hard to feed her family and send her children to school.

Francisca plans to use her loan to buy more clothes and Avon products to sell. She is hoping for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and married. She has four children, age 9, 14, 20 and 21. 

Lorna runs a fishing business with her husband. According to her, fishing has been their main source of income for the past 20 years. Lorna does her best to improve their business and keep their family together.

Lorna requested this loan to buy fishing nets, bait and crab traps. This will help Lorna and her husband have more fish to catch and sell.

In the future, Lorna hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bait and crab traps.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 42-year-old married woman with eight children. The oldest child is 17 years old. Rita's husband works as a farmer.

Rita is also a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She and her husband own a plot of land that they till to grow rice crops. They also hire laborers to help till their land. According to Rita, they sell their harvest to rice traders and this earns them about 5000 PHP per month. Rita does her best to assist her husband with their business and send their children to school.

Rita requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Rita hopes that in the future, her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу 30 лет, замужем и растит трехлетнюю дочь и 10-месячного сына. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Канымбу начала свой бизнес в торговле продуктами питания и  оказание услуг общепита.  Магазин, в котором торгует Канымбу, наполовину обустроен как столовая, где можно перекусить и закупить необходимые продукты. Канымбу приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успехов – ее бизнес приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Канымбу обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.
texts.en: Kanymbu is 30 years old and married.  She has a 3-year-old daughter and a 10-month-old son.  In search of a source of income for her family, Kanymbu decided to launch her own food sale and catering business.  The shop in which Kanymbu works also serves as a dining room.  One can have a bite to eat and buy the necessary food products.  Kanymbu has worked very hard to develop her business and has been very successful:  her business now brings in close to 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  Today, Kanymbu doesn't have a wide range of food items.  This is why she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners and requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow her to buy a broader range of merchandise, attract a larger number of customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy a broader variety of food products.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru: Зеби одна из первых клиентов организации, которая имеет семейный бизнес по продаже конфет и печеных изделий. Она торгует вместе со своим мужем, и товар привозят вместе. Зеби смогла с помощью кредитов развернуть свой товарооборот в несколько раз.У неё трое детей, два сына и одна дочь, которая учится в университете. Для достижения хороших результатов в учёбе Зеби решила купить своей дочке студентке нотбук и подала очередную заявку на получение займа.За свою кредитную историю Зеби ни разу не нарушала условия организации и довольна сотрудничеству.
texts.en: Zebi is one of the first clients of our organization.  She has a family business of selling candy and baked goods.  She works together with her husband, and they bring in the merchandise together.  With the help of loans, Zebi was able to increase her product turnover by several times.  She has three children - two sons and one daughter, who attends a university.  In order to achieve good results in studies, Zebi decided to buy a laptop for her student daughter and requested this loan for this purpose.  Throughout her entire credit history, Zebi has never violated any of the organization's terms and is satisfied with the partnership.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her daughter

loans.name: Sok Loeurt

texts.en:
Sok Loeurt, 26, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running a motor taxi for over two years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. His wife is a garment worker. 

In order to improve his family's living conditions, Sok Loeurt is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service for tourists to generate more income. In the future, he would like to put up a grocery store for his wife and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a TUK TUK (motorcycle taxi) to run a transportation service for tourists.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Марифат женщина 37 лет, за мужем, имеет троих детей. Её муж в отъезде в Р.Ф на заработки. Каждый месяц присылает семье на расходы семьи. Марифат любит ухаживать за скотом, который ей оставил муж. Она доярка и продаёт коровье молоко соседям в посёлке. Марифат узнав от брата , что сейчас на рынке подешевел скот, решила  также получив кредит закупить пару коров и корм для них. Она кредитуется в организации с 2009 года и благодарит всех инвесторов организации.
texts.en: Marifat is a 37 year-old woman, who has three children.  Her husband is away, working in the Russian Federation.  He sends money to the family every month for their expenses.  Marifat loves to take care of livestock that her husband left her.  She is a milkmaid and sells cow milk to her neighbors in the village.  Marifat learned from her brother that livestock prices dropped at the market and decided to obtain a loan to purchase a couple of cows and fodder for them.  She has been obtaining financing from the organization since 2009 and thanks all of the organization's investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Teht

texts.en:
Mrs. Teht, 38, is a married woman who has been living in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. To make a living, Mrs. Teht is selling fast food in and around her community using her old motorcycle connected to a trailer at the side. She always sells different kinds of meatballs and she is able to earn income of approximately $3.50 per day in order to support her financial expenses. Mrs. Teht has three single children and most of them sell some mixed items.

Mrs. Teht is requesting this loan to buy a second-hand motorbike to replace the broken one. With the rest of loan funds, she will support her children’s mixed product selling business. As for her future plans, she intends to expand her children's business to large size and to build a new house which is bigger than their current house.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorbike to replace the broken one used to transport food for sale.

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en: Samneang, 26, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business of buying junk materials to sell at the junk shop for over five years and is successful in his career. His wife is employed at the garment factory. Due to low income from his business, Samneang is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service to generate income. By doing so, his family economic circumstances will be better developed because running TUK TUK can make more profit. In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service to generate income.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat, 33, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a construction foreman for over ten years. Due to his difficulty in travelling to work, Sinat is requesting for a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support the family. In addition, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over three years. Her husband has been running a business buying junk materials to sell for over six years and is successful in his career. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Sorphorn is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry junk materials to sell at the junk shop. With a motorcycle, her husband would be able to carry junk materials in larger amounts to sell and generate more profit to support the family. In the future, Sorphorn would like to run a junk shop at home, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to carry junk materials to sell at the junk shop.

loans.name: Horm

texts.en:
Most people living in rural areas prefer working in the farming business. Mrs. Horm is one of them, making a living by planting rice crops. She is now 64 years old and a single parent of two single children. She typically earns a net income of around $3.00 a day from her business. One of her children is involved in the construction sector. And he has a few laborers to help provide his service as well. He receives many orders from his clients to construct their houses. 

Lately, Mrs. Horm’s son has been very busy with his business due to there being many clients who need him to build their houses, but he still lacks construction materials. That is why Mrs. Horm has requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials to assist her son’s business.

loans.use: to buy extra construction materials to assist her son’s business.

loans.name: Abdukaum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм  клиент в организации с 2008 года, который каждый кредит использует на расширение бизнеса животноводства , на увеличение скота. Он с молодости занимался на рынке куплей и  продажей скота, поэтому хорошо разбирается в породистых коровах и баранах. У него сейчас две коровы и шесть баранов. На следующий кредит он планирует купить корову и несколько голов баранов. Его жена занимается домашними делами и продажей домашнего молока. Абдукаюм  кроме откорма работает в бригаде строителем, а из-за того что данная деятельность является сезонной , поэтому в зимний период он занимается  откормом и продажей скота.
texts.en: Abdukaum has been a borrower since 2008 and uses every loan to expand his animal husbandry business and increase his herd.  Since Abdukaum has been buying and selling livestock at a market from a young age, he has become an expert in pedigreed cows and sheep.  He currently owns two cows and six sheep.  With his loan, Abdukaum is planning to buy a cow and a few sheep.  His wife takes care of household chores and sells home-produced milk.  Beside his work in animal husbandry, Abdukaum also works as a builder in a construction team, but this activity is seasonal, so in the winter he is involved in the fattening and the sale of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a few sheep.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.ru:
Элвире 29 лет, замужем.  Элвира  - актриса музыкально-драматического театра, здесь также музыкантом работает и муж Элвиры. Старший сын этой семьи пошел по стопам родителей и поступил в музыкальное школу-училище в  столице г. Бишкек.  
В качестве дополнительного источника финансирования своей семьи,  Элвира начала бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  Начатое еще в 2006 году с суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство, насчитывающее две коровы и пять баранов, сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   Скопив необходимую сумму с прибыли от бизнеса, Элвира с мужем купили музыкальный аппарат для записи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Элвира обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Элвира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Elvira is 29 years old, and married. She is an actress in the theatre, and where her husband also works as a musician. The family's eldest son followed in the footsteps of his parents and entered music school in the capitol, Bishkek. To augment the family's finances, Elvira started a business in raising and selling livestock. Started in 2006 with a starting capital of 8,000 somi (KGS), the farm, which began with two cows and five sheep, now brings in about 5,000 somi (KGS) a month from the sale of diary products. 

After having saved up the needed amount from the profits from the business, Elvira and her husband purchased some music recording equipment. To further increase her numbers of livestock, Elivra has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in amount of 90,000 somi (KGS) to purchase more livestock. Elvira plans to use the receipts from the loan for increasing her numbers of domestic livestock, and in the near-future — to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Munyasya

texts.en:
Munyasya is 36 years old, married and has four children.  He has been farming so as to earn a living.  He has employed three people to assist him in his farm.  Through the knowledge he has gained from Faulu Kenya about business management skills, he has improved his business.  

He hopes to grow his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 31 years old, married and has three children.  He makes and sells drums and traditional guitars to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed four people.  He also sells charcoal for extra income generation. 
 
Through Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy raw materials for making drums such as wood and skins.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood and skins.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared, 29 years old, is married and has three children.  To earn a living, he does farming.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He mainly grows spinach, tomatoes and kale.  He has employed three people in his farm.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access business loans and has been trained in business management skills.

Jared hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years.  He needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram has been farming for eight years.  The 32-year-old man was previously operating a motorbike transport business.  He works hard in his business so as to provide for his wife and six children. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to gain a lot of skills in business management.  This is because he has been trained in business management skills.

Joram needs a loan of 20,000 Kes to bu fertilizer, seeds and a water pump.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and a water pump.

loans.name: Darika

texts.ru:
Дарике 55 лет, замужем, мать шестерых детей.  
Основная деятельность Дарики – это откорм и перепродажа скота.  Начатое еще в 1992 году с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.   Также, в сезон Дарика подрабатывает швеей и сезонно получает до 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Дарика обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку баранов и коз. Доходы от кредита Дарика планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Darika is 55, married, and the mother of six children. Darika's main occupation is raising and selling livestock. Begun in 1992 with 2,000 somi (KGS), Darika's farm earns around 5,000 somi (KGS) a month from the sale of dairy and meat products. Darika also works on the side as a seamstress on a seasonal basis, and earns up to 5,000 somi (KGS) per season. Darika has gone to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 somi to purchase sheep and goats. She plans to use the receipts from the loan to acquire more livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Patrice

texts.en:
Patrice is forty-nine years old, married to Jane, and they have four children. He has operated a boutique in Kimilili town in western Kenya for the last seven years.

 He is requesting his first loan from KADET Ltd of Kes 30,000 which he will use to buy clothing for his boutique. He will use the profits to add more stock.

His dream is to have a stable boutique business.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married to Sylvester, and they have been blessed with two children. She has been buying and selling maize for last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 3000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 10,000 which she intends to use to purchase more maize for sale. She plans to pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is  forty-one years old, comes from Western Kenya, and is married to Peter. They have four children. She has operated a fish selling business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of Kes 13,000. 

She is requesting her 3rd loan from KADET Ltd of Kes 30,000 which she will use to purchase fish for sale. She will plough back the profits into the business.

Her dream is to extend her business to neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 47 years old, married to Fransisca, and they are blessed with two children. He has been selling livestock for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his fourth loan with KADET in the amount of Kes 49,000. He will use the loan to buy more livestock (goats, cows, sheep) for resale. With the anticipated profits from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old and single with two children aged 12 and 16. She runs a retail shop to earn a living,and she has been in the business for three years. She describes her business environment as busy because she is visited regularly by her customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy loaves of bread, sodas and sugar.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread, sodas and sugar.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 69 years old, married to David, and they are blessed with six children. She has been a private school director for the past fifteen years with a monthly income of Kes 25,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for a first loan with KADET Ltd  after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Martha will use the loan to build more classrooms. With the anticipated profit from the business she will further expand the school. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open another school.

loans.use: To build more classrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jeco

texts.en:
Jeco is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jeco has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jeco has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jeco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and only one child. He’s considered as the main source of income in the family and is working really hard to provide a better future for his young child. He started his own metal workshop in 2005. Today, he wants to take out a youth loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra metal products for his business. He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase extra metal products for his business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Evangeline has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four school-aged children. He’s their main source of income and they all depend on him. He’s also paying his children’s educational fees. 

Khoder has been working in metal for the past eight years on a free-lance basis. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a pick-up which will facilitate his transportation. This Kiva loan will help him collect higher income and improve his life. In the future, he plans to expand his business and gain added customers.

loans.use: to purchase a pick-up, which will facilitate his transportation needs.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Irish  is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools & gasoline for the services.

Irish  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irish hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old, married to Mary, and they are blessed with four children. He has been rearing poultry for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 25,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy poultry feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Roderic is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Roderic is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Roderic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roderic hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Fidaa

texts.en:
Fidaa is a 42 years old, married, and has six children who attend school. She has been working as a tailor from her home for the past 11 years. She is stylish and fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. 

Fidaa is requesting a loan for $1,600 Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to purchase a new tailoring machine in order to improve her business and increase her productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop and expand her business outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old and a widower with four children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a   monthly income of Kes 8,500 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Daniel will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Alura

texts.en:
Alura is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children.
 
Alura has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Alura has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jayette

texts.en:
Jayette is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jayette is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Jayette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jayette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and oil for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old, married to Dominic, and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 25,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan of Kes 47,748 with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy a piece of land. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 11 children. 

Rosalina has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ellie

texts.en:
Ellie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Ellie has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ellie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells food items such as canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 50 years old, a single mother of two children.  She has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of Kes 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

 Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to build rental houses on.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Evelyn has a shop that sells vegetables & spices like onions, garlic & black pepper. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean  is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mary Jean  has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Mary Jean  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mary Jean  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 44 years old, a single mother of two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of Kes 10,500 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd  of Kes   47,748 after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land to build rental houses on.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and seven children. She earns a living running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Felecia joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Awaot

texts.en: Awaot is 35 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling food from a stall located in Bor, South Sudan. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy sugar and oil to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income she earns as a result of this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar and oil to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari or variety store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Analyn joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old, married and has five children who range in age from one to 12 years old.  He is a very determined businessman who earns a living by renting out housing to people who live in his area. He has been in this line of work for seven years and before that made a living by running a grocery store. He is applying for a loan for Kes. 20,000 to renovate some of his rental houses. His goal for the future is to own more rental property.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his rental houses.

loans.name: Media

texts.en:
Media is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. 

Media is providing "trisikad" or pedicab services. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools for the trisikad.

Media has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Media hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the "trisikad" (pedicab).

loans.name: Hazef

texts.en:
Hazef is 53 years old, married with five children. He does dairy farming to earn a living, and he has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 75,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 20 years old, married to Joash, and they have five children. She has been in the fish selling business for two years with a monthly income KES. 20,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET LTD of KES. 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more fish for sale. She plans to repay the loan   with anticipated profit from the business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Grace has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 49, is married to Peter and they are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 30,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 38,500. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land for farming purposes. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children between the ages of 4 and 8. She describes herself as aggressive and determined. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good environment for sales. In addition, she also provides rental house services. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat. Faith's business goal is to run more butcher shops within five years.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 32 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Philippines. Marialyn has a junk shop that buys and sells recycled materials such as plastic bottles, metals, and cans. She has had this business for five years. 

Marialyn  is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy recycled materials such as plastic bottles and metals.  Marialyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase recycled materials.

loans.name: Osanva

texts.en:
49-year-old Osanva is a married woman, with two children to take good care of. A year ago, Osanva moved to her new shop. This decision to expand her business was an important one. Thirteen years ago, Osanva opened her own clothing shop, in order to help her husband in covering their family's expenses. Her extensive experience has provided her with the necessary skills and customer service techniques to attract new customers and gain their trust.

Osanva has been a borrower from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for three consecutive cycles. Her previous loans were invested in her business, which improved her social and financial situations. Today Osanva is applying for a loan in order to add more items to her winter collection. 

Osanva plans to expand her business more in the future, through introducing new products and moving to a larger space.

loans.use: To buy a new winter collection of clothes for resale

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Delfina has a junk shop that buys & sells recycled materials like plastic bottles, metals & cans. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles & metals.

Delfina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delfina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials like plastic bottles & metals.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 47 years old, married to Monica, and they are blessed with four children. He has been practicing farming for the past six years with a monthly income of Kes 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET of Kes 23,400, which he will use to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land for large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is the main income provider in the family and he strives to work hard to be able to live properly.  Siham started her own home business as a tailor in 2008 and has six years of experience in this field. 

Siham is requesting a loan for $1,300 Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to purchase raw materials such as textiles. She notes that this loan will boost her productivity, sales, and revenues.  In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as textiles.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with three children. 

Vanessa has a food shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vanessa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vanessa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Lorna has a food shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 39 years old and married with two children aged 9 and 16. He bakes to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed three people. 

He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy baking powder and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy baking powder and cooking oil

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 21,000 with KADET ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
45-year-old Hakob owns a metal lathe turning shop. He moved to this new place in January 2011 because he needed a wider place to do his business. He works in turning metals from non-useful to useful ones in addition to manufacturing non-existing metals on request.

Such a business is highly recommended but requires enough capital to keep buying updated machines.

Hakob is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new, updated machine that is necessary for his business.

This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His last loan was also invested in buying a necessary machine, the thing that he intends to continue buying in the future.

Hakob is a married man with one child. He works hard to provide him with the best education and healthy living. He hopes to keep improving and developing his business and social life.

loans.use: To buy a new, updated machine necessary for his business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from three to nine years old. He describes himself to be committed and consistent to his work. 

James operates a retail store where he sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a conducive environment. In addition, he also provides phone repair.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more phone accessories. James's business goal is to run a bigger phone-selling shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Editha has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses, and sweaters. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing.

Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosalie has a food shop, or "sari-sari" store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosalie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab is a 53-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one working sibling. She collaborates with her father to be able to satisfy their family's needs and demands. She opened her own grocery store in her town in 2009 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop

loans.name: Egla

texts.en:
Egla is 52 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a food store at her local trading center and has been in operation for 18 years earning a monthly income of 32,000 KES.

Egla is requesting her third loan with KADET for 100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase 50 bags of dry maize and 10 bags of dry beans for resale. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.  She will use the anticipated profits to start a dairy farm and extend her passion fruit farm. Her dream is to be financially stable and succeed in business.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Eugenia has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Eugenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eugenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Weddy

texts.en: Weddy is a 33-year-old single woman. She has 4 children, ages ranging from 5 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a populated area. She also runs a retail shop to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more livestock for milking. Weddy's hope and dream is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Clemencia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She been in business for fifteen years.

Clemencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

In the future, Clemencia hopes to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 35 years old, married and has two children. He owns a food cereals store in his local trading center and has been in operation for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Alfred is requesting a fourth loan of 90,000 KES from KADET. He will use the funds to purchase more cereals for his store. The profits will be used to educate his children and increase stock levels in his business.

Alfred’s dream is to prosper in business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for his store.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has one child. Teodora provides manicure and pedicure services and has been in business for four years.

Teodora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional supplies for her services.

Teodora’s hope is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her pedicure and manicure services.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and has two children, a son and a daughter. He describes himself as social and honest.

For the past six years John has run a green grocery where he sells vegetables and fruits such as oranges, onions, kale, etc. His business draws both repeat and new customers. The high cost of fruits and vegetables is his biggest challenge.

John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from SMEP, which he will use to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

John’s hope is to venture into a new retail shop business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of detergents and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Tessie has a food shop or carenderia where she sells tasty dishes such as afritada and caldereta. She has been in business for ten years.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy the ingredients for her dishes.

Tessie’s hope is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for her dishes.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is forty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Merlita provides transportation for customers with her motorela, or motorcycle with a sidecar, with her husband as the driver. She has been in business for five years. 

Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the motorcycle. Her hope is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is applying for another loan through Yehu to expand her current business. She will use this 45,000 KES loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Beatrice aspires to continue improving her business.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Beatrice has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Rosalinda has a sari-sari store [food shop] that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is 48 years old, married, and has six children. He runs a retail shop in his local trading center and has been in this business for 10 years earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Rodgers is applying for his second loan with KADET for 40,000 KES, which he will  use to purchase stock of rice, maize, flour, sugar, and cooking oil for his shop. The anticipated profits will be put back into the business. His dreams are to prosper in business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, maize, flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest and God-fearing.

For the past five years Margaret has operated a green grocery where she sells vegetables and fruit such as oranges, onions, kale, etc. Her business is located near a busy road where she attracts both repeat and new customers. The high cost of fruit and vegetables is her biggest business challenge.

Margaret will use her 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell. Her goal is to venture into a new retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with three children. She has sold trousers, shoes and bags to earn a living for the past four years. She earns extra income from her farm as well.

Since Catherine joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children. She has applied for a 60,000 KES loan to buy additional trousers, bags and shoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional trousers, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира трудолюбивая женщина. У нее прекрасный любящий муж. Детей у них нет. Для своей семьи они хотят создать все хорошие условия и для этого им приходиться много работать. Она занимается откормом скота. В этом деле ей помогает муж. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота. В настоящее время скот на рынке немного дешевле, поэтому ей нужны средства. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Она хочет получить займ в размере 6 800 сомони. Она думает, то её поддержат и протянут руку помощи.
texts.en: Zamira is hardworking woman. She has a wonderful loving husband but no children. Together they want to create good living conditions for their family and so both of them work very hard. Zamira raises cattle with her husband. She wants to purchase more animals for her herd since right now livestock prices are lower then usual, but she lacks the capital for it. Zamira hopes that you will be able to help her with a loan of 6800 somoni for this venture. She is grateful in advance for your helping hand.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with two children. For the past ten years she has had a food shop or sari-sari store from which she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Antonia has a party shop that provides sound system services for special occasions. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy materials needed for maintenance of the sound system for the service.

Antonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for maintenance of the sound system for the service.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is applying for another loan to construct a home. She will use this 80,000 KES loan to purchase construction materials for the construction of her house and also pay the laborers for their services. 

In the future, Mwanaidi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanaidi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for the construction of her house and also pay the laborers for their services.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has a son who is 7 years old. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. 

Monicah operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a busy market and her primary customers are repeat and new. She describes her biggest business challenge as the increase in the price of the meat sometimes. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more meat.

loans.use: to buy more meat.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 36-year-old, married woman with one child who has completed high school. Her husband, Ashraff, is a tailor who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs.  Janet lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food for her family and the electricity bill. 

Janet has operated a business selling fried potatoes for the past 10 years.  Her potential clients are the local area residents. Janet must deal with the challenge of debtors not paying their debts on time.  She dreams of owning a house in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Janet wants to purchase additional potato stock and cooking oil for her business.  She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loan opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase more potato stock and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a 40-year-old, married woman with four children.  She has been a bread distributor who operates a retail shop for the past 10 years.

Jedidah is applying for her second loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  She was introduced to the organization by another KADET client.  Jedidah requests a loan of 100,000 KES to buy bread stock for distribution to her customers and to supply her shop.  In the future she aspires to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy bread for distribution

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 30-year-old, married woman with five children, four of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Sarah requests this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with two children who are 18 and 22 years old respectively.  He describes himself as humble, God fearing, honest, and social.  Juma operates a retail business selling clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are the area residents.  In addition, Juma is a farmer and runs a grocery store to increase his income. His biggest business challenges are transportation problems when delivering clothes and the high cost of clothes. 

Juma will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell.  His business goal is to start a wholesale retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell from his retail business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband, Awadh, is employed and contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. Mariam owns a house with piped water, but no electricity.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and her children’s school fees. 

Mariam has operated a café for the past year and her potential clients are the local area residents.  She faces a major challenge of competition from other café operators.  Mariam dreams of expanding her business. 

Mariam will use the Kshs 20,000 loan to purchase more rice, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and salt for her café.  She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, maize and wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to use at her café.

loans.name: Waweru

texts.en:
Waweru is 47 years old and married to Esther.  They have five children.  He makes bricks to sell, a business in which he has been involved for the last five years.  Waweru earns a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

Waweru is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner KADET Ltd.  He plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase firewood to bake bricks and to pay wages.  Waweru plans to open a shop for his wife with the anticipated profits from the business and to pay school fees. 

His hopes and dreams are to become large scale brick seller and businessman.

loans.use: To buy materials for his brick production business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Augustine, is employed and contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs.  Mary lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mary has operated a vegetable stall for the past three months and her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. Mary dreams of expanding her business.

Mary wants to use the Kshs 10,000 loan to purchase more vegetable stock, such as tomatoes, onions, and cabbage, for resale.  She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loan opportunities to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable stock for resale from her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Olais

texts.en:
Olais is 42 years old and married with four children.  He runs a butcher shop, a business in which he has been involved for 19 years.  Olais employs two people. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Olais has been able to save his income since he joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable in the future.  Olais has applied for 20,000 KES to buy goats to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy goats to slaughter for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 39-year-old, married man.  He has three children between the ages of 12 and 19 years old. He describes himself as honest.  Juma operates a retail store where he sells coconuts. He has been involved in this business for two years.  His business is located viable area and his primary customers are both return customers and new ones. He says his biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. 

Juma will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more coconuts to sell.  His business goal is to run a coconut industry within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell from his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase printing materials, such as toner cartridges and paper.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 41 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in the Ornlong Veng district.  Chan comes from a low-income family and operates a retail business. She sells Khmer cakes in a busy market. She has run this business for many years  and earns $4.00 a day. Her husband generates a small profit by working as a soldier at Preah Vihear province.  

Recently, Chan's living conditions have not been comfortable because a part of her house is broken down and old so it is harmful for her family to live in it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Kheaiv

texts.en:
Kheaiv is the loving mother of four teenage children who are no longer in school. Two of her children are working as garment factory workers, and they each contribute some of their income to help meet the family’s daily expenses. Her husband is a fisherman who works along a local river.

Kheaiv is a local farmer in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province where she has planted her crops for many years. Besides this, she often sells the fish that her husband caught or she buys from other fishermen. She currently earns an average of $1.40 a day.

Because she lacks extra capital to improve her farming capacity during the dry season, Kheaiv is asking for a 700 USD loan from HKL. She will use it to buy a water pump, fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 27 years old and married with three children. He runs an electronics shop and repairs bicycles to earn a living. He has been in business for four years and describes his ventures as competitive because many people are in the same trades.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Samson has been able to improve his living standards. He has now applied for a 20,000 KES loan to buy phone chargers and bicycle spare parts. He hopes to expand his businesses and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy phone chargers and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fill the ground below her house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old married woman with six children ranging in age from five to 20. For the past five years, she has operated a store where she sells clothes. Jane describes herself as loving. Her business is located a viable area and her primary customers are women. Jane's biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. 

Jane is requesting a 20,000 KES to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to have enough capital to be able to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Lornah

texts.en:
Lornah is 25 years old and married to Jacob. They have three children. For the past ten years, she has been selling onions, tomatoes, and fruit. Lornah earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Lornah is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase more tomatoes, onions, and fruit. This is her first loan with KADET Ltd and she plans to repay the loan with her anticipated profit. In the future, Lornah hopes and dreams of owing a large grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and fruit

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married with two children. He repairs motor vehicles to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old. She and her husband Stephen have four children. She has been selling onions and tomatoes for last 10 years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She is borrowing her first loan of 30,000 KES, with which she plans to purchase more tomatoes and onions for resale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to repay the loan. 

Her hope and dream is to own a large green grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akech is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Joyce Mutano

texts.en:
Joyce Mutano is a 31-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is married. She has been a shopkeeper for the last three years successfully.

This is Joyce’s third loan from KADET. She plans to purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour for her stock. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Akuol

texts.en:
Akuol is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akuol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 39 years old and married with two children. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years and has employed one person.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benard has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rachiel

texts.en:
Rachiel is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Rachiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Belook

texts.en:
Belook is a 28-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Belook is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Achut

texts.en:
Achut is a 29-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Achut is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mathaa

texts.en:
Mathaa is 62 years old and married with four children. 

She sells vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes to earn a living. She also earns extra income from her farming activities. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is less competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mathaa has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont toutes mariées, ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à HEREMAKONO CENTRE, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’huile alimentaire avec SAFIATOU, de céréales, de poissons, des condiments alimentaires et de la restauration.
SAFIATOU, seau plastique sur son pied, en chemise rose, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 bidons d’huile alimentaire. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of DANAYA are all married and, in average, are 38 and have 4 children. They live in monogamous families in HEREMAKONO CENTRE, a district of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is the fourth time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is into cooking oil with SAFIATOU, cereals, fish, condiments, and catering.
SAFIATOU (the one with a plastic bucket in her lap, wearing an orange shirt) plans on buying 5 drums of cooking oil. She buys these items from wholesalers at the big market of Bougouni. She sells them at the big market of Bougouni as well as door-to-door to a customer base composed of men and women, who pay cash or on credit.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband pay for their daily expenses. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy drums of cooking oil.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old and married with a 7-year-old child. For the past two years, she has sold blouses, skirts, and shoes to earn a living and she has employed one person. She is able to earn extra income from her employment and has been able to expand her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. 

Ruth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future, she hopes to continue to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Finesse est un regroupement de 4 femmes ayant en moyenne 35  ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à HEREMAKONO NORD, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures avec  SALIMATA , de la fabrication et vente de savons traditionnels et des légumes.
SALIMATA, en T-shirt bleu,  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux colis de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Finesse is a group composed of 4 women who, in average, are 35, have 6 children, and live in nuclear families in HEREMAKONO NORD, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of Mali).
This is the first time they collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women is into shoes with SALIMATA, vegetables, and making and selling traditional soap.
With this loan, SALIMATA, wearing a blue T-shirt, plans on buying 2 loads of plastic shoes. She buys these items at the big market of Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. She sells them retail at the market in Bougouni as well as door-to-door to a customer base composed mainly of women, who pay cash or on credit, daily or weekly.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband pay for their daily expenses. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
MIRIYA est un regroupement de 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, de céréales, de légumes et biens d’autres articles divers. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à Bougouni ville (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe  a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et  est à son deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier. 
MOSSODIE, assise à droite avec une grande tasse remplie de sorgho, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 6 sacs de sorgho et 5 sacs de fonio. Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires environnantes de Bougouni et effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 15.000 FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
MIRIYA is a group of 4 women who are either related or neighbors. They are 34 years old in average. Married, and with at least 4 children, they all have various activities like selling fabrics, cereals (like MOSSODIE), vegetables, and many other items. They live in traditional families in the city of Bougouni (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).
In order to better meet the needs of their customers, the group has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their second loan, having successfully paid back the first one.
With this loan, MOSSODIE (the one with a large container filed with sorghum) plans on buying 6 bags of sorghum and 5 bags of fonio. She buys these items in markets around Bougouni and sells them retail, cash or on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of consumers.
She hopes for a 15.000 FCFA profit, which will enable her to pay back her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Oñondivepa se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lucila, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 28 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 9 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Lucila trabaja en la cría de animales, como ser de cerdos y gallinas, por medio de su arduo trabajo ha logrado mantener a su familia y darles un estilo de vida digno y decoroso. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de su trabajo ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto. Su sueño es poder tener una granja donde poder tener más animales y de esa forma poder seguir progresando.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar lechones, pollitos para la cría, además de eso para la compra de alimentos para estos. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This excellent group of women from the city of Ita is called “Oñondivepa.” Lucila, its current director, contacted the advisor during a weekly meeting she had in the same zone to learn about the work the Enterprising Women’s Committee does.  Once advised about the Program, she managed to get 28 women together who are now working very comfortably in their 9th cycle in a unified, supportive way within the program.

Lucila works in animal husbandry.  She raises pigs and chickens.  Through her hard work she’s managed to support her family and provide them with a dignified, proper lifestyle.  She comments that she’s very proud of her work because it’s a proper job and above all is honest.  Her dream it to be able to have a farm where she can have more animals and thus continue to make progress.

She’s asking for the loan to buy piglets and chicks to raise as well as to buy feed for them.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks and feed for them.

loans.name: Boresh Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her mid 50s, is married with seven children and three of them are still going to school. She has had a charcoal business for 15 years now.  She works from six in the morning through six in the evening daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. Zena will share this loan with her loan group, Boresh, which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Zena is requesting her fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzani to buy more sacks of charcoal.  She used her previous loans to increase her charcoal stock, sell vitumbua (sweet fried rice cakes), and provide for her household expenses. She has successfully repaid all of her loans.  Zena's dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Bernadate

texts.en:
