Bernadate is 50 years old. She is married to Sospeter and supports a family of six members.  She runs a posho mill (a grinding machine to crush maize into maize flour). She has been in business for seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She is borrowing KES 80,000 which she will use to pay school fees. Her hopes are to educate her children to college level.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las emprendedoras se denomina el buen   grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a  la Sra. Aparicia quien supo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, por lo que se informó e invitó a sus vecinas y amigas a formar su propio grupo. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra integrado por 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el primer ciclo y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel.
Aparicia, la presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la venta de chipas, que es una alimento tradicional, preparado a base de almidón. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena venta, debido a que la chipa siempre es muy consumida, haga frió o calor. Por medio de su sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante y hoy en día ya es una microempresaria.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de manteca, almidón, anís, huevos, queso y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar las chipas que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, tanto ella como sus amigas.
texts.en:
These entrepreneurs call themselves “El Buen Grupo de Mujeres” (The Good Group of Women).  They joined together in the city of Ita thanks to Aparicia who found out about Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Committee and invited her friends and neighbors to form their own group.  It currently has 17 members who are working in their first cycle and want to reach the maximum level.

Aparicia, group President, sells “chipas,” a traditional food based on starch.  She comments that her sales are good because chipas are always well consumed whether it’s hot or cold outside.  Through her sacrifice and effort she’s been able to get ahead and today is a micro businesswoman.

She requests the Fundación’s and Kiva’s help to buy shortening, starch, anise, eggs, cheese and other necessary ingredients to make the chipas she sells.  She is thankful for the opportunity she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy shortening, flour, anise, eggs, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 43 years old, married with 3 children aged 3, 7 and 9. He runs a tailoring business to earn a living, and has been in this business for 4 years. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to put his children through good schools in the future. He has applied for 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy material to tailor.

loans.use: To buy material to tailor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 40 years old. She is married and has three children aged three, six and nine. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to educate her children and be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair-drying machine and weaves.

loans.use: To buy a hair-drying machine and weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair classrooms and to purchase desks.

loans.name: Nanjii

texts.en:
Mr. Nanjii, 55, is a carpenter and makes Mongolian traditional furniture for his neighbors and his permanent customers. He has been running his business for 20 years and lives with his wife. All of his children have moved out.

Now he needs money to increase his business working capital. It is important for the persistent running of his business. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase raw materials for carpentry.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for carpentry

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old, married and has four children. He runs a retail shop and he has been in business for 4 years earning a monthly income of 35,000 KES.

He is borrowing his first loan with KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES. He intends to use the funds to purchase sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and other items for the retail shop. With the anticipated profits, he will pay back the loan.

His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase stock like tea leaves, cooking fat, sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married to Leonard and they have four children. She has been selling fish for the last 15 years, earning her a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET Ltd. of 30,000 KES which she intends to use to purchase more fish for sale. She plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profits from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Nipher

texts.en:
Nipher is 23 years old and married with one child. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. She earns extra income from her farming activities.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loans.use: to buy a blow dry machine and a hairdryer

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old and married to Moses. They have four children. She has been operating a pharmacy for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET LTD for KES 30,000, which she intends to use to purchase a stock of medicines and introduce new variety. She plans to open another shop with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a wholesale dealership.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicine.

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Arandu, se conformó en el 2.009, gracias a una de las ex miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras capaces de sobrellevar cualquier desafío.
Gregoria es una de las integrantes de este grupo trabajador. Ella comenta que se dedica a la elaboración de ñanduti, el cual es un tejido tradicional de Paraguay. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que siempre es muy solicitado el tejido. Comenta que su sueño es que su producto sea exportado y de esa forma ser muy conocida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de todo tipo, agujas y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración del tejido que vende. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Arandu” women’s committee formed in 2009 thanks to an ex-member.  They are currently in their 8th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Program.  They are very hardworking, tenacious women who are capable of overcoming any challenge.

Gregoria is one of this hardworking group’s members.  She comments that she makes “ñanduti,” a traditional Paraguayan textile.  She comments that she does quite well because her textiles are always highly sought after.  She comments that her dream is that her product is exported and becomes very well known.

She requested the loan to buy all types of thread, needles and other supplies needed to make this textile that she sells.  She is thankful for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy thread and needles.

loans.name: Aluel

texts.en:
Aluel is 38 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are in school. She has had a business selling food at a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Aluel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 44 years old, married and blessed with four children. She owns a retail shop in her local trading centre and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting her third loan with KADET LTD of KES 100,000. She will use the funds to purchase more stock, i.e. cooking fat, rice, maize flour and detergents for her business. She will plow back the anticipated profits into the business and repay the loan.

Her dream is to prosper in her business and live a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, sugar, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 41 years old and married with four children. She sells bananas, oranges and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is less competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy bananas, oranges and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges and tomatoes

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a 38-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a cereals store in her local trading centre. She has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is applying for her first loan with KADET of 30,000 KES. She plans to use the funds to purchase 12 bags of dry maize. With the anticipated profits, she will repay the loan and save. 
She hopes and dreams of improving the living conditions of her family and prospering in business.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize for resale

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 19-year-old divorced young lady. She is now working as a hairstylist in one of the beauty salons in their neighborhood. After getting divorced, Lubna went back to live with her sisters and parents. Her father, Nidal, has his own portable booth for selling fruits and vegetables, where he keeps on moving between the streets and the alleys to sell. 
 
As a help to her father Nidal who appears in the picture for conservative reasons instead of Lubna, she decided to apply for a loan to repair his booth and buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To repair her father's fruit stall and buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married to Moses. They are blessed with one child. She has been selling locks for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Elizabeth will use the loan to buy a stock of locks for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy locks to sell

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 44-year-old divorced lady who has been working as a tailor for the last five years. Since she started, she has been able to buy another sewing machine. She also provides a gift-wrapping service.

Now Wafaa has applied for a loan to buy more material so she can later expand and open her own workshop rather than working at home.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is 36 years old and married with two children. She sells sweaters and blouses to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and describes her business environment as busy because many people visit her daily. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters and blouses to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters and blouses to sell

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling food at a stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Nyanluak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se unieron para trabajar juntas y por medio de este trabajo en conjunto salir adelante y apoyarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Leticia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo.
Sus ventas han ayudado a Leticia a tener los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y de esa forma poder tener un estilo de vida decoroso. Ella se esfuerza constantemente para ser mejor cada día. Dice que tiene muy buena clientela y eso la ayuda mucho.
Solicita la ayuda de kiva y de fundación paraguaya para la compra de gaseosas, agua tónica, cervezas, whiskys y demás tipos de bebidas.
texts.en:
Twelve women from the city of Itá, all of them friends and neighbors from that city joined together to work together and through this work get ahead and support each other.  They are currently in the third cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women’s Program.

Leticia is one of the group members.  She is a very hardworking woman and she comments that she sells all types of beverages.

Her sales have helped Leticia to have the necessary income to help her family get ahead and to have a decorous lifestyle.  She strives constantly to be better every day.  She says that she has a very good clientele and this helps her very much.

She is asking for Kiva’s and Fundación Paraguaya’s help to buy soft-drinks, tonic water, beer, whisky and other types of beverages.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, tonic water, beer, whisky and other types of beverages.

loans.name: Dunhill

texts.en:
Dunhill is a 60-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Dunhill will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 45 years old, is a  housewife who is married to Bassam, a taxi driver.

Fatmeh used to make scarves and clothes for her children with knitting wool until almost five years ago, when her sons and daughters grew up and convinced her to continue making and selling, because the designs she makes are not much available in the market.

Knitting wool to make scarves, gloves, and tops using her creativity, and with the help of her family who brings her new customers every time, she was able to help improve their family income level.

Now, Fatmeh wants to open her own store with a small workshop and employ people who need help, but to achieve this goal she first wants to increase her profit by making and selling more goods. For that reason, she has applied for a loan to buy more material and simple accessories to be used on clothes.

loans.use: to buy more wool and simple accessories to be used on clothes

loans.name: Mercy Marlene

texts.es:
Mercy Marlene tiene 30 años es casada vive con el esposo y con el hijo en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.
Mercy Marlene se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz de ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la siembra de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar las semillas y demás productos sin ningún tipo de problemas y podrá aportar con dinero para el bienestar de la familia.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. El sueño es tener maquinaria para poder trabajar en la tierra.

En el tiempo libre le gusta conversar.
texts.en:
Mercy Marlene, 30, is married and lives with her husband and son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) communal band located in Recinto San Luis de Zapotal belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Mercy Marlene farms short cycle corn.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids for her corn crops.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy seeds and other products problem-free and will be able to contribute money toward her family’s wellbeing.

The challenges she faces are infestations, crop diseases and weather variations.  Her dream is to have machinery to work the land.  In her free time she likes to have conversations.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man, age 31, and a resident of Fort Portal, Uganda, living in a semi-permanent house. He runs a garage, which he started four years back. He started working for someone where he gained a lot of experience and started his own garage. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business dream is to own a very big garage in town. Stephen wants the loan to buy modernized machines for vehicle repair.

loans.use: to buy modernized machines for vehicle repair.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald tiene una imprenta con la cual genera sus ingresos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina tipográfica, pues la que está usando es antigua y ya no funciona correctamente. Ronald  es soltero  y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Huaychani de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a Impro y la segunda vez con kiva. Su historial crediticio es excelente.
texts.en: Ronald has a print shop that generates his income. He needs the loan to buy a printing machine because the one he’s using is antique and does not function correctly.  Ronald is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Huaychani zone.  This is the fifth time he’s worked with Impro and the second with Kiva.  His credit history is excellent.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine for his print shop.

loans.name: Olga Natividad

texts.es:
Olga Natividad tiene 41 años es casada tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Olga se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de ciclo corto como es la siembra de maíz, además tiene una casa. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de calidad y grandes, abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos, Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar las semillas y otros productos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Olga Natividad, 41, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Tierra Nuestra” (Our Land) communal band located in Recinto San Luis de Zapotal belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Olga Natividad farms short cycle corn.  Her purchases and sales of farm products take place in Ventanas.  She’s asking for the loan to buy quality seeds and large amounts of manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy seeds and other products.

The challenges she faces are infestations, crop diseases and weather variations.  Her dream is to buy land and in her free time she enjoys going out on excursions.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and large amounts of manure, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is acquiring a loan to service his car. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is age 55 and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his six children. He has been in the transport business for the past 25 years. High fuel costs and taxes hinder his business but his dream is to buy another vehicle so as to spread the risk. His personal dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong is a 49-year-old married woman with three children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling food from her stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Atong is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram, 49 years old, is widowed. She has been working in the retail business for almost 8 years, but on a small scale and from home. She buys blankets, cover sheets and kitchen products and sells them to neighbors and friends. Using word-of-mouth, she has been able to reach many people, but she is still not satisfied. So, she applied for a loan to buy more products and attract more people. She hopes to open a shop in the market to make it easier for new customers to reach her.

loans.use: to buy more home products and blankets

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma tiene una tienda de barrio donde vende golosinas y productos de primera necesidad para el hogar. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital ya que abrirá una carnicería y para lo mismo necesita comprar una maquina cortadora. Zulma es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Los Pinos de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera  vez que trabaja junto a Impro y Kiva.
texts.en: Zulma has a neighborhood store where she sells snacks and basic staple items for the home.  She needs the loan to increase capital because she will open a butcher shop and needs to buy a cutting machine.  Zulma is single and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Los Pinos zone.  This is the first time she’s worked with Impro and with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a meat cutting machine because she intends to add meat sales to her grocery store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a businessman who runs a computer college to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He is also married and has one child aged 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to open a secondary school in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy computers.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Blás

texts.es:
Blás es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 54 años de edad y  trabaja en la construcción  hace más de 40 años y también posee un Cyber. Está casado con la señora Vicenta que es la encargada de atender el negocio, tienen 4 hijos por los cuales el, tanto su esposa se esfuerzan al máximo.
Blás nos comenta que ha trabajo sacrificadamente por 40 años en un oficio muy pesado y que gracias al apoyo de au esposa y de su familia ha podido abrir un ciber con el cual tiene un poco de ingresos extras que aportan muy bien para los gastos de la casa. El sueño de Blás es poder seguir creciendo, y es en miras a ese sueño que solicita el crédito a kiva y fundación paraguaya, para poder pagar mantenimientos a las maquinas del ciber, de esa forma podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blás comes from the city of Paraguarí. He is 54 years old, has worked in construction for over 40 years and also has an internet cafe. He is married to Vicenta, who is in charge of running the business. They have four children, which is why both he and his wife push themselves to the limit. 

Blás tells us that he has made the sacrifice to work in a very difficult industry for 40 years, but thanks to the help of his wife and his family he was able to open an internet cafe, which gives him some extra income to put towards the household bills. Blás' dream is to continue expanding his business, which is why he has applied for a loan from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to pay for the maintenance of the computers in his internet cafe so that he can offer the best possible service to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the computers in his internet cafe

loans.name: Mary Celeste

texts.es:
Mary Celeste tiene 28 años de edad es soltera vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Mary se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol, arveja. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos, abonos, urea, insecticidas para las siembras. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia dedicándose a la siembra para que el producto salga bueno y poder venderlo a un buen precio.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar terreno.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mary Celeste is 28 years old, single and lives with her parents in Ventanas, Provincia de Los Ríos. She is a member of VRC Tierra Nuestra, located in the San Luis de Zapotal precinct which is part of the Ventanas district. This Ventanas local works in agriculture, planting corn and rice as part of the short sowing season. As well as corn, she also sows beans and peas. The sale and purchase of this produce is all done in Ventanas.

Mary Celeste is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, solid and liquid fertiliser, urea and insecticide for the sowing season. With the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her family's lifestyle, dedicating herself to sowing so that her produce grows well, which will enable her to go on to sell it at a good price. 

The challenges that Mary Celeste faces are plagues, diseases and changeable weather. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. In her spare time, Mary Celeste likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, solid and liquid fertiliser, urea and insecticide for the sowing season

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen, aged 57, lives in Masindi Uganda and has a dream of setting up a number of income-generating activities that are sustainable. He is a livestock farmer and his desire is to diversify his business by acquiring more land to grow crops & expand into new markets. Stephen intends to buy a lawn mower for cutting grass in a bid to diversify his income sources.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower for cutting grass.

loans.name: Stuart

texts.en: Stuart is 41 years old, married, and a father of 4 children. For ten years he has been working as a civil servant. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation and yet the salary he earns does not increase with the current hyper inflation. He wishes to invest in self-education and he is requesting a loan to start working towards his dream of self education. Stuart needs the loan facility to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es: La señora Janneth es profesora del nivel primario y su esposo trabaja en la mina. Con dichas actividades ellos generan ingresos para ayudar a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para compra de una impresora y material didáctico para facilitar su trabajo. Janneth  es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es independiente. Vive en casa en anticretico la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Rió Seco  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Es la tercera vez que trabaja con Impro y la segunda vez junto a Kiva.
texts.en:
Janneth is a primary school teacher and her husband works in a mine. With these jobs they make an income to help their family. She needs the loan to purchase a printer and educational material to facilitate her work. 

Janneth is married and has three children, one of which is independent. She lives in a house under an "anticrético" rental contract located in the area of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. This is the third time she has worked with Impro and the second time together with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a printer and educational material for her work as a teacher.

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en: Ajoh is 28 years old and married with no children. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Ajoh is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mutemi

texts.en:
Mutemi is 38 years old and married to Jane. They are blessed with three children. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hope and dream is to buy a pick-up car for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 48-year-old hardworking woman. She is married and has four sons and daughters. For 11 years, Ameera has been working at home as a tailor and an embroiderer. She is well known for the embroidered dresses she makes. Not only do individuals come to make special orders for embroidered Abaya and dresses, but also shops take a good quantity from her and sell them in the market.

Now Ameera has applied for a loan to buy more materials that are used in embroidery so she can increase her productivity and distribute to more shops.

loans.use: to buy more material for embroidery

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is a 32-year-old married mother of two children living in Hoima, Uganda. She is hardworking and for the past two years, she has been running a restaurant which has been steadily improving. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation of food items. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand her business into new markets. Evelyne needs the loan facility to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans for his stock

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 25 years old and married with two children. He owns a produce business, which he has been operating for three years. He started as a crop farmer and saved to start his current business. He has a challenge of high transport costs while transporting goods from the farmers to the market. His family goal is to educate his children and he hopes to expand his business to new neighboring markets. Benjamin needs the loan facility to purchase rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Nyanlueth

texts.en:
Nyanlueth is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for one year.

Nyanlueth is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La señora Andrea se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace tres años y con la tienda de su propiedad desde hace un año cuenta con buena clientela ya que las personas ahora quieren utilizar medicamentos que no tengan químicos, vive en domicilio de sus padres donde vive con  su esposo y su hija de cuatro años solicita el crédito para la  compra de  mercadería medicamentos naturales y de esta forma surtir su tienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo, le va muy bien con la venta de estos productos, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación, con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Andrea has sold natural medicines for three years. She has had her own store for a year with a good customer base since people want to take medicine that does not contain chemicals. She lives in her parents’ home with her husband and her four-year-old daughter. She is requesting a loan to purchase her natural medicine merchandise. She can stock her store and increase her working capital. She is doing very well with the sales of these products. She is a young person with a great desire to succeed and improve the quality of her life and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 40 years old and married with five children. She owns a produce business and she has been doing this for the past five years. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation, however she hopes to build a permanent family house and move her business to a more permanent location. Mildred needs a loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Bashayer

texts.en: Bashayer, 42 years old, is a housewife. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Bashayer started a small home business three years ago making sweets, especially chocolate sweets, to sell. Because she loves what she does, she was able to make her small business a success and expand it to make new types of chocolate desserts. By word of mouth, she gained a good number of customers. Now, Bashayer wants to continue on the same track growing step by step. She has applied for a loan to buy special equipment and tools to make the process of making those desserts easier and faster.

loans.use: To buy a special machine to make chocolate

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old, married to Victoria and they are blessed with two children. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Francis will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is 30 years old and single. She has been operating a yogurt business for the past five years. She started as a farmer, and after saving enough, she ventured into her current business. She has a challenge of her customers not paying on time, and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Moreen needs a loan to purchase a yogurt packing machine.

loans.use: to buy a yogurt packing machine.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 29-year-old married woman with four children; two of the children are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan, for one year.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 32 years old and married with five children. He owns a produce business. He started as an errand boy, and after accumulating enough wages, he ventured into rice selling. He has a challenge of high transportation costs, and his business dream is to buy his own vehicle. His family dream is to educate his children up to the university level. Christopher needs the loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Nyandit

texts.en:
Nyandit is a 33-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past year she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan. 

Nyandit is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income she generates from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kivanga

texts.en:
Kivanga is 53 years old. He is married to Regina and they are blessed with six children. He has been running a retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

After being introduced by an existing KADET customer, he is applying for his first loan of with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000. He will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de carpinteria junto con su esposo,ellos realizan trabajoc como mesas,sillas,puertas y ventanas,ella vende en las distintas ferias que se realizan en el distrito de Cachimayo,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de su carpinteria.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y madera para hacer los trabajos de carpinteria.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina continues making a living in carpentry along with her husband. They are doing jobs making tables, chairs, doors and windows, and she sells the items at the distinctive trade fairs in the district of Cachimayo. She wants to make headway with the business, and her dream is to expand her carpentry shop. She is requesting the loan to purchase tools and wood to do her work. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase tools and wood for her carpentry work.

loans.name: Evans Mwatete

texts.en:
Evans Mwatete is a 48-year-old taxi owner in Vok, Mombasa. He is a married father of three and has successfully been a taxi operator for the last year. 

This is Evans’ first loan from KADET. He plans to buy spare parts and repair his vehicle. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes to attain financial independence and support his family.

loans.use: buy spare parts and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia Victoria se sigue dedicando al negocio de desayunos,ella prepara quinua,quaker,chocolate y maca,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hsta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los desayunos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los desayunos como panes,leche,quinua y maca al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Victoria, is still working in her breakfast business. She prepares quinoa, quaker oats, chocolate and maca. She works as a street vendor. The member works from 8.00 am until 6.00 pm. Through this business she is getting her children ahead in life. Her dream is to have a premises where she can sell the breakfasts. The member is requesting the loan to buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients to prepare breakfasts, such as bread, milk, quinoa and maca.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 30-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three working siblings in addition to seven relatives. Her siblings are working really hard to cover their heavy costs especially because they are a big family. As for her, she has been working as a tailor for the past fifteen years to help her relative with his education. For this reason, she has the intention today to take a youth loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay the education fees of her relative until he graduates. In the future, she plans to develop her work and provide more support for her siblings.

loans.use: to pay the education fees for her relative.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La señora María es cliente de la institución desde el 2006 antes trabajaba con el grupo solidario Fuego pero el grupo se  separo y ella continuo con nosotros en forma individual pagando puntualmente sus cuotas,  ella vive en la zona  de Chasquipampa a una cuadra de la agencia tiene tres hijos,  ella junto a su marido se dedican a la elaboración de pan desde hace varios años,  gracias a su actividad ellos están saliendo adelante el préstamo que están solicitando es para la compra de harina y manteca para la elaboración del pan y así de esta manera incrementar sus ventas, son una familia muy unida agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado con la institución ya que gracias a su apoyo creció en su actividad y mejoro la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: María has been a client of this institution since 2006. Previously, she worked with the "Fuego" solidarity group, but that group broke up, and she continued with us on an individual basis, paying her instalments promptly. She lives in the Chasquipampa area, a block from our office. She has three children. She and her husband have been baking bread for several years. Thanks to their hard work they are getting ahead in life. They are applying for the loan in order to buy flour and shortening. They are a very close-knit family, and are thankful for the help that the institution offers them.

loans.use: To buy flour and shortening

loans.name: Isabel Robertina

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel es una cliente que pertenece al Banco de Emprendimiento TUNKA  de la institución ella tiene cuatro hijos 2 de ellos se encuentran en la  Universidad, 1 en el colegio y el otro en casa , la señora Isabel se dedica a hacer prendas a pedido y también ella confecciona, vive en la zona de Villa Victoria en la casa de su suegro, pero se trasladaran muy pronto ya que están acabando de construir su casa, su negocio se encuentra en la zona de Achumani muy lejos de su domicilio, por tal  motivo la Sra. Isabel se levanta muy temprano para hacer los que aceres de la casa y luego trasladarse a su negocio,   el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de telas e hilos ya que en esta época hay mucho movimiento y necesita confeccionar prendas al por mayor y así de esta manera poder incrementar su capital ya que sus clientes le hacen pedidos y tiene trabajo que entregar.
texts.en:
Isabel is a client of the institution and member of the communal bank "TUNKA".  She has four children, two of which are in college, one in school, and the other at home.  Isabel sews on an order basis and also makes her own designs.  She lives in the Villa Victoria area in her father-in-law's home, but as soon as her house is finished they will be moving.  Her business is located in the Achumani area, quite a distance from where she lives.  Therefore Isabel gets up very early to do her housework before going off to work.  

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread because there is much demand during this time of year and she will begin sewing wholesale garments.  This will allow her to increase her capital for the orders her customers have already placed and which she must deliver.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans and other clothing items.

loans.name: Nzingo Mugoja

texts.en:
Nzingo Mugoja is a 40-year-old livestock-keeper in Mariakani. She is a married mother of six. She is has been selling livestock and livestock products for the last two years and she is doing great.

This is Nzingo’s third loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more goats, cows and sheep. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows and sheep.

loans.name: Áreas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Área lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Raquel quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años en el mercedo más grande de Managua.  Ella invertirá el crédito en chayote, tomate, zanahoria, papa…etc. 
Las otras integrantes son Sebastian quien se dedica al comercio de tamarindo desde hace 7 años y Javier quien se dedica al comercio de fruta y verduras desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The "Área" group has three members, all enterprising and hard-working people.  Sra. Raquel has been selling fruit and vegetables for four years at the largest market in Masaya.  She will use this loan to buy chayote (pear squash), tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, etc. 

The other members of the group are Sebastiana who has been selling tamarind for seven years, and Javier who has sold fruits and vegetables for six years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for food-sales business.

loans.name: Quelita

texts.es: Quelita, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Cesar quien es agricultor, fruto de ésta unión tiene 04 hermosos hijos de 22, 21, 20 y 14 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Quelita es la venta de abarrotes para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, iniciando hace 06 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional. Éste negocio no fue posible gracias a un préstamo más un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros que los utilizó para montar su tienda, y con el tiempo ha crecido y captado muchos clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite   estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad de un ingreso económico, además del tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades  y el cuidado de su hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta cuando sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras pues comenta ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de venta pues no le pagaron los créditos, por eso ahora se niega a realizar este tipo de venta y todo lo vende al contado, y ve que tiene mejores resultados. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliando su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor buscando los mejores precios y más bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias, además como juguetes para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Quelita, 53, is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  Her common-law husband, Cesar, is a farmer and they have four beautiful children, ages 22, 21, 20 and 14, who they love very much.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Quelita sells groceries out of a store set up in her house.  Here she attends to her customers, the majority of whom are neighbors.  She started the business to make extra income and has been in it now for six years.  With the help of a loan and her own savings she was able to set up the store and over time has grown and attraced many customers.

She enjoys her work because it allows her to be at home and have an income while also having free time for other activities and housework.  What she does not like so much is when customers ask for credit for their purchases since she has had several bad experiences.  So now she sells everything on a cash basis which gives her better results.  

She plans to continue growing and expanding the business.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support so she can carry out her plans.  She likes her communal bank and knows all the members, who she considers to be responsible, supportive people.  The 1,200 PEN loan will be used to buy wholesale groceries, at the best prices possible, in order to improve earnings.  She will also buy toys for this Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Los Garcias Group

texts.es:
El grupo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es  Mayra del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 5 años.  Ella está casada con don Eddy con el cual tiene dos hijos. 
El crédito lo  invertirá en mercadería en especial pantalones y blusas.
Los otros integrantes son Juan quien se dedica al comercio en general desde hace varios años y Manuel quien se dedica al comercio general es decir vende de todo un poco.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people. One of them is Mayra del Carmen who has sold clothes for a living for the past 5 years. She is married to Don Eddy, with whom she has two children.

She will invest the loan in merchandise, in particular pants and blouses.

The other members are Juan, who has sold general items for several years, and Manuel who also sells general items, in other words a little of everything.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, pants and blouses

loans.name: Martir Group

texts.es:
El grupo Martir lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Teresa del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio de ropa  desde hace 11 años aproximadamente. Ella está casada con don José quien es constructor y ambos trabajan duro para salir adelante. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en  mercadería en especial pantalones y blusas.
Las otras integrantes son Martir Isabel  quien tiene una pulpería desde 5 años y Josefa quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
The Martir group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial people.  One of them is Teresa del Carmen, who has been selling clothes for approximately 11 years.  She is married to José, who is a builder, and they both work hard to get ahead in life.

Teresa del Carmen will invest her loan in merchandise, especially pants (trousers) and blouses.

The other members of the group are Martir Isabel, who has owned a grocery store for 5 years, and Josefa, who has been selling footwear for 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men, women and children

loans.name: Delina

texts.es: Delina, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Walner quien es empleado. Juntos habitan en la casa de sus suegro en compañía de su hijo, sus suegros y cuñados. La actividad que realiza Delina es la venta de comida como juanes y asados de pollos, instalando su mesa en el frontis de la casa de su suegro, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Tiene más de 01 año en éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su suegra para la preparación y atención de los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades de  su pequeño hijo quien es la motivación para seguir progresando. Sin embargo, el alza de los precios de los insumos que debe cobrar sube y eso reduce sus ganancias. Tiene planes de seguir y mantener su negocio, por ello desea ampliarlo comprando sillas y mesas para mayor comodidad de sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas y cumplidos. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida a precio por mayor para así tener mejores ganancias, tales como arroz, aceites, papas, y demás.
texts.en:
24-year-old Delina is a hard-working and determined woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She lives with her common-law husband Walner, who is an employee.  They live together in her in-laws' home together with their son, her in-laws and brother- and sisters-in-law.  Delina's business is selling food such as 'juanes' and roast chicken.  She sets up her table in front of her father-in-law's home and serves her customers in a kind and friendly manner.  She has more than a year's experience in this business and, up to now, she has had the support of her mother-in-law in preparing her food and serving her customers, who are mainly neighbors.

Delina enjoys her business as it allows her to make income with which she can cover her household expenses and the needs of her young son who is her motivation to continue making progress.  However, the supplies that she needs rise in price and this reduces her profits.  She has plans to continue in her business and keep it running.  To achieve this, she would like to expand it, buying tables and chairs so that she can make her customers more comfortable.

This will be Delina's second loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the financial support that they give her so that she can continue in her business and make progress with her plans.  She says that she feels comfortable with her community bank as she considers the members to be good and thoughtful people.  Delina will invest her 1,500 soles in buying ingredients for preparing her food wholesale.  This will make her better profits.  She will buy supplies such as rice, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is aged 42 and has seven children all of whom go to school. She is married to an artist. She sells meat and she has been running this business for 20 years. With the loan, she plans to buy more meat to sell. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: En El Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo En el nombre de Dios  lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es  Miriam quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 4 años e invertirá el crédito en carne, pollo, enchiladas, repochetas, tajadas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son  Ana quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos  desde hace 2 años y Bismar quien se dedica a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group 'En el nombre de Dios' (In the name of God) is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Miriam. She has had a fried food stand for the last four years and will use this loan to purchase beef, chicken, enchiladas, taco shells, tajadas, etc.
The other members are: Ana, who has been selling cosmetics for the last two years, and Bismar, who sells second hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,ella prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still running her restaurant, where she prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner, working from 8 am to 8 pm. Thanks to this business she brings up her children. Her dream is to expand and improve her restaurant. She applies for this loan to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk, such as rice, vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Martha tiene 36 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Antes Martha se dedicaba a la venta de ropa para niños Manuelitos (Jesús), para virgen y para santos pero cambio de actividad. Actualmente, su actividad económica principal de Martha es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y un depósito de cerveza. Ya son dos meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar tres cajas de cerveza.
texts.en: The communal bank "Andrés Avelino Cáceres" is made up of responsible and hard-working people who make their families progress. Most of its members live and work in Cusco, a city known as a popular tourist resort as well as for its commercial activities and its traditional Inti Raymi festival. One of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Machu Picchu, is nearby. Martha is 36 years old, married and has two children from her marriage. She was born in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco, and lives in her beautiful native city. Earlier, se sold clothes for the Niño Manuelito (Jesus) (*) and the statues of the Virgin and the saints, but now she has a new activity. Currently, her main economic activity is the sale of food products from her small grocery and her beer depot. She has already been working for two months in her new business and is doing very well. Today Martha applies for a loan to buy three crates of beer. (*) Translator's note: A detailed explanation of the Niño Manuelito tradition is provided in a previous Kiva loan description: "Each Christmas Eve in the city's main square, Peru's largest popular art and crafts fair is held: the Santurantikuy Fair. Hundreds of artisans from various places in the Cusco area, as well as other regions of the country, come to show their beautiful and original creations, fruit of their creative spirit during the year, which are used to decorate nativity scenes in homes and institutions. The central figure of Cusco's Christmas fiesta is the Niño Manuelito."

loans.use: to buy three crates of beer.

loans.name: Heisen

texts.es: Heisen, de 30 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso y trabajador, además de tener muchas gana de salir adelante, convive con Jessica quien le ayuda en la atención de su negocio familiar. Juntos habitan en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo de 4 años. La actividad que realiza es el alquiler de videojuegos para eso cuenta con 04 equipos instalados en su propia casa donde tiene un ambiente con mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Es así que sus cabina son alquiladas a vecinos y  personas que solicitan el servicio, asimismo nos comenta que éste negocio lo aprendió hace 5 años de sus hermanos que también ejercen el mismo rubro. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar y éste capital comenzó con su propio negocio y ahora atiende a lada de su pareja. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar además de tener una ocupación, viendo la rentabilidad que le deja su negocio pues aprendió de sus hermanos. Ahora lo que más prioriza es terminar sus estudios técnicos en construcción civil y constituir una oficina de asesoría de estudios de planos, para eso desea comenzar con una computadora. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contento con el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de contar con el apoyo de su banco comunal, donde se siente cómodo y en confianza. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora con los planes de brindar servicio de asesoria en construcción civil.
texts.en:
Heisen, aged 30, is a hard-working man who wants to progress. He lives in a common-law marriage with Jessica who helps him attending the family business. They live in their own house with their four-year-old son. Heisen's activity consists in renting video games. He has installed four play stations at home, where he has a room with tables and chairs for the convenience of his customers. The booths are rented to neighbors and other people requesting his services. He told us that he learned this activity five years ago from his brothers who are also active in this business. Eventually he managed to save some money and used it as start capital for his own business, and now he and his partner attend it together. He likes his business because it gives him an income to cover household expenses and keeps him busy.

Now his highest priority is to finish his education as a civil engineer and open a consulting business to draw up design plans. He wants to start with the purchase of a computer. To realize his plans and get the needed financial resources, he came to the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma and applied for his second loan. He likes his communal bank, because in addition to their support he feels at ease and confident when dealing with them. He will invest the 1200 new soles of the loan in a computer with the goal to provide consultancy services in civil engineering.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restuarant,ella prepara platos como cuy al horno,pollo al horno y sopas,la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien vende gaseosas y cervezas,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras y tambien para comprar cerveza y gaseosas al por amyor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still running her restaurant. She prepares dishes like roasted guinea pig, roasted chicken and soups. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She also sells soft drinks and beer. Thanks to this business she can bring up her children. Her dream is to expand the guests' area of her restaurant. She applies for this loan to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy beer and soft drinks in bulk. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes, such as meat, chicken and vegetables, and also to buy beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Vilma tiene 42 años de edad y es madre solera y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco y vive en la hermosa ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal de Vilma es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo ovejas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Ya son dos meses que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Andrés Avelino Cáceres" is made up of responsible and hard-working people who make their families progress. Most of its members live and work in Cusco, a city known as a popular tourist resort as well as for its commercial activities and its traditional Inti Raymi festival. One of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Machu Picchu, is nearby.

Vilma is 42 years old and the single mother of two children. She was born in the province of Calca, department of Cusco, and lives in her beautiful native city. Her main economic activity consists in breeding small animals, such as sheep, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. She has been working for two months in this business and is doing very well. Today Vilma applies for a loan to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casada,  vive con su  hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar materiales para la construcción de su gallinero y gallinas para aumentar el número. Ella actualmente tiene su granja establecida y necesita amplíala y a su vez aumentar la cantidad de gallinas poniendo. Ella pretende con este aumento de gallinas tener más producción y así poder abastecer al mercado de la localidad generando así ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Shirley is 44 years old and married.  She lives with her son and husband who are her highest priority.  With the loan she plans to purchase construction materials for her hen house so she can increase the numbers.  She currently has an established farm and needs to expand it, while at the same time increase the quantity of laying hens. She aims to increase her production with more hens and be able to supply the town market, thereby generating more income for the well-being of her family.  

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She has never taken out other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: expand her hen house.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Rosamaria

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Rosamaria tiene 35 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Yanatile de la provincia de Calca departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Rosamaria es la venta de comestibles, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Tambien, Rosamaria venta de gas en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Rosamaria requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas. Su sueño de Rosamaria es ampliar el negocio de venta de gas.
texts.en:
The communal bank  “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” is made up of responsible, hard-working people who provide for their families.  The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco, where they also work.  Cusco is known for its tourism and business, its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for having one of the Seven Wonders of the World, "Machupicchu".  

Rosamaria is 35 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has two children.  She was born in the Yanatile district in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco, but lives in the beautiful city of Calca.  Rosamaria sells groceries for a living and has a grocery store in her home.  She has been running this business for three years and things are going well for her. Rosamaria also sells gas from her home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar as well as other things.  Her dream is to expand her gas sales business.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Neuz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Neuz lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Alberto  quien tiene una caponera desde hace un año, además distribuye perfumes productos de limpieza. El invertirá el crédito en la compra de otra caponera ya que con la que tiene no da abasto.
Las otras integrantes son Pilar quien tiene una pulpería y refresquería desde hace 2 años  y Sofia quien vende buñuelos, atol, arroz de leche…entre otros postres tradicionales.
texts.en:
The Neuz group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Alberto, who has had a motorcycle taxi for a year. He also distributes perfumes and cleaning products. He will invest the loan in buying another motorcycle taxi, since the one he has isn't enough. 

The other members are Pilar, who has had a small store and snack shop for two years, and Sofia, who sells buñuelos, atole, rice pudding, and other traditional desserts.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 50 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de tener muchas ganas de sobresalir, es separada, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos mayores de 30 y 27 años de edad, habitando en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Carmen es la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas, y pasteles para promociones, bodas y demás acontecimientos sociales. Actualmente tiene muchos pedidos por el buen trabajo que realiza, por ello continua actualizándose, pues considera que siempre  hay cosas nuevas que aprender, contando con un horno en su casa, donde realiza todos su preparaciones y atiende a sus clientes desde hace 22 años. Le gusta la repostería así como las manualidades, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder de convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Por eso tiene planes de abrir una fuente de soda en su casa, ya que su ubicación en una esquina es estratégica para un buen negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de torta para esta campaña de de promociones de los colegios, asi como en moldes y utensilios de repostería.
texts.en: Carmen is 50 years old and a hardworking and dedicated woman. She really wants to get ahead. She is separated and lives with her two grown children, aged 30 and 27, in their own home. Carmen's activity is making pastries. She learned this trade studying a a local work training center, where they taught her to make delicious cakes and desserts for graduations, weddings, and other social events. At present, she has a lot of orders due to the good work she does. She continues to keep herself up to date because there are always new things to learn. She has an oven in her house where she has made her goods and served customers for 22 years. She likes making pastries and crafts as well. She likes her trade because it has brought her a lot of satisfaction, such as income and being able to become an entrepreneur. She has plans to open a soda fountain in her house, since her corner location is strategic for a good business. This would be the second loan she has had with the MFP institution. She is happy with the financial support to advance her business. She also likes her communal bank because she thinks the members are good people. With the amount she has asked for, 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying ingredients to make cakes for this graduation season, as well as molds and pastry utensils.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, utensils and molds for making cakes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Francisca tiene 59 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella nació en el distrito de Sicuani  de la provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Francisca es la venta de chicha de jora de lunes a viernes, ella tiene una pequeña picantería en su domicilio y está abierto a los clientes a partir de las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Francisca requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz para elaborar más jora.
texts.en:
The Andrés Avelino Cáceres communal bank is comprised of responsible and hard-working people who get their families ahead.  Most of the members live in Cusco, where they conduct their business activities.  Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

Francisca, age 59, is married and has three children.  She was born in the Sicuani district in the Canchis province of the Cusco department.  However, she lives in the beautiful city of Calca.

Francisca’s main business activity is selling “chicha de jora” (a traditional, corn-based drink) on Mondays through Fridays.  She has a small snack shop in her home.  It is open to customers from ten in the morning until three in the afternoon.  She has had this business for four years, and it is going very well for her.

Francisca now needs the loan to buy corn in order to make more jora.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Andrés Avelino Cáceres” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

Gabino tiene 63 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, él nació en el distrito de Sicuani de la provincia de Canchis departamento del Cusco pero vive en la hermosa ciudad de Calca. Su actividad económica principal de Gabino es la venta de artesanía de tipo tejido, él vende sus productos de forma ambulatoria en las ciudad de Calca, Pisaq y Ollantaytambo.  Ya son diez años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Gabino requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo mantas, chalinas y chullos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Andrés Avelino Caceres" is composed of responsible persons and workers that are moving their families forward. The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco where they practice their economic activities. Cusco is known for being a zone for tourism and commerce because of its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because one can find one of the seven wonders of the world "Machupicchu" there.

Gabino is 63 years old, is married, and the fruit of this beautiful relationship is his three children. He was born in the district of Sicuani of the Canchis province section of Cusco, but he lives in the pretty city of Calca. Gabino's primary economic activity is the sale of knitted artisan crafts . He sells his products on the street in the cities of Calca, Pisaq and Ollantaytambo. 10 years have passed during which he has dedicated himself to this business and it is going very well. For this opportunity, Gabino requires a loan to buy mechandise like, for example, blankets, scarves and hats.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise like, for example, blankets, scarves and hats.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales,al socia cria cuyes y gallinas y tambien tiene una chacra donde cultiva maiz y papa,los productos y animales los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Cachimayo,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales y sus productos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes,gallinas y tambien para comprar fertilizantes para su chacra.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Josefa continues to dedicate herself to the business of raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens and also she has a ranch where she grows corn and potatoes. She sells the produce and animals in different fairs that exist in the district of Chachimayo. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell the animals and her produce. She solicits the loan to be able to buy guinea pigs, chickens and also to buy fertilizers for her ranch. She is happy because of the loan and she promises to comply with the payments for her share.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, chickens and also to buy fertilizers for her ranch.

loans.name: Gadir

texts.en:
Gadir is a 35-year-old mother of two from Haifa. She has both training and experience in child care. Gadir decided it was time to take her future in her hands and decided to open a daycare in her home. She registered through her municipality and is now able to receive children and their monthly fee directly from the municipality. 

Gadir has an excellent reputation in her area for creating a warm, loving environment for the children. In order to open her daycare, Gadir needed to make renovations to the rooms she would use. 

She needed this loan to renovate & paint and purchase safety bars, carpets, toys and equipment.

Gadir wants to see her daycare grow and thrive, creating a secure and nurturing environment for children in her care.
