This is why he turns to the loans that the MFP institution facilitates.  But now what he gives priority to is planting more coffee plants.

This will be his eighth loan with MFP.  He feels that the money from the loan will help him a lot in the progress of his work.  In his communal bank he is a member who is well loved by the rest of his companions because is is very supportive with them.

With the 1,000 PEN he will buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formada por 11 socias y 1 socio  quienes en su mayor parte se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería realizando los trabajos del campo, algunos diariamente salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades, son personas amables, responsables y carismáticas, viven por los alrededores del Cantón Nabón en la Provincia del Azuay, este lugar es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes en donde se puede observar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, su gente es amable, cálida y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Silvia, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga.

Tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño de un año de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Silvia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para la venta y también para su consumo. Cría y vende ganado, borregos, cerdos, patos y cuyes.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para arar y cultivar sus terrenos, va a comprar semillas y abono y fertilizantes.
 
Su meta es tener más ganado. 

Los dos niños de la fotografía son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Entrada a Chunazaca" is made up of eleven women members and one man, most of whom work in agriculture and livestock, working in the fields.  Several of them go to the city on a daily basis to work in different activities.  They are friendly, responsible, and charismatic people, who live in the surroundings of the Nabón Canton, in the province of Azuay.  This area has a cool climate, and has beautiful countryside where you can see nature in all its splendor.  The people are friendly and warm, and keep up the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of this group is Señora Silvia.  This is her second loan with the communal bank, to which she was invited to by a friend.

She is 23 years old and married, with a year-old baby from this marriage.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not have their own home, so they live in her mom's house, where they share the household expenses.
 
Señora Silvia works doing her household chores and in agriculture.  Her harvest is for sale and also for her own consumption.  She raises and sells cattle, sheep, pigs, ducks and guinea pigs.

She will invest the money from the loan to prepare and cultivate her fields.  She will purchase seeds, manure, and fertilizers.

Her goal is to have more cattle.

The two children in the photo are children of two of the members.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato, de 46 años de edad, por problemas familiares vive separado de su pareja y esta al cuidado de sus 05 queridos hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia en el distrito de kimbiri. Honorato cumple con ser padre y madre dentro de su cesta familiar. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y cuenta con un terreno con plantaciones de Piña.  Honorato viene trabajando 23 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros para avanzar con mayor rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. El crédito solicitado es para poder comprar más semillas de las plantas de piña y poder renovarlos por las plantas de café; por que los frutos de la piña le generan mayor ingreso y en menor tiempo. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará  más semillas de piña para poder incrementar en su chacra.
texts.en: Honorato, who is 46 years old, lives separate from his partner because of family problems.  He is caring for his 5 beloved children.  They live together in his own home in the Kimbiri district.  Honorato fulfills the role of father and mother due to his family's circumstances.  Since he was very young, his parents instilled in him how to work on the small farm.  He is a country-person and depends on a plot of land with pineapple plantations.  Honorato has been working for 23 years on his own land.  During the harvest times he counts on the support of his children and day laborers to make progress more quickly with the extraction of the fruits.  What he likes the most about his job is harvesting the fruits from the plants, since he feels that the challenging months provide him with compensation for the quality of his fruits.  He considers that the most difficult part is transporting his products from the small farm to the city of San Franscisco, the place where they give him the best prices for his products.  He is asking for the loan to be able to buy more pineapple plant seeds and to be able to exchange them for the coffee plants, because the pineapple fruits generate a better income and in less time.  This will be his 3rd loan with MFP.  He knows that if he pays it on time, he will be able to obtain another loan with greater ease, and he will not bring complications to his communal bank.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy more pineapple seeds in order to improve his farm.

loans.use: buy more pineapple seeds.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, esta casado con Albina de 47 años y fruto de su relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Alta. Máximo, empezó como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro le llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 22 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando plantas de café. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor rapidez. Se siente muy comprometido con la labor que realiza; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo; hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan muy abundantes, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de café que los llega a vender; cuenta que en temporada de lluvias no es de su agrado porque en estos tiempos abundan los insectos así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para que pueda comprar fertilizantes y abono para realizar el mantenimiento de su café y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.  Este es el crédito numero 06 con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles,  comprara  fertilizantes y abono para realizar el mantenimiento de su café y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Máximo, who is 47 years old, is a very hardworking man.  He is married to Albina, who is 47 years old.  A benefit of their relationship is that they have 3 children, and they live in their own home which is located in the community of Vista Alegre Alta.  Máximo began working as a farmer as a very young child on his parents' land.  His passion for the farming world drove him to acquire his own lands.  He has been working independently for 22 years cultivating coffee plants.  During harvest time, he counts on the support of day laborers who see to removing the fruits of each product with quickly.  This way he is able to advance with great speed.  He feels very dedicated to the work that he does.  Thanks to his effort, today he enjoys seeing the resulting abundant fruits of his plant.  Therefore, he is obtaining good earnings for each kilogram of coffee that he sells.  He says that in the rainy season, he is not pleased.  During these times, insects are plentiful and stand in the way of achieving his work, and they are detrimental to the fruits of his plantations.  The loan is being requested so that he can buy fertilizers and manure to maintain his coffee and get a good profit from his fruits in less time.  This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he is dedicated to paying all the dues punctually since he wants to obtain another loan in the future.  In his communal bank, he is a very beloved member.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy fertilizers and manure to maintain his coffee and get a good profit from his fruits in less time.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Mirian tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos que se dedican a estudiar.
doña Mirian es una mujer emprendedora, hace un año se vio en la necesidad de invertir en muebles de madera para ser comercializados, El esposo de Mirian tiene un taller que fabrica puertas, ventanas, mesas, sillas y otros productos mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de muebles.
El sueño de doña Mirian es que sus hijos se graduen y que su negocio sea el mejor de la zona.
texts.en: Mirian, age 40, is married and has three children who are currently studying. Mirian is an entrepreneurial woman; a year ago she decided to invest into wooden furniture in order to resell it. Her husband has a workshop which makes doors, windows, tables, chairs, and other products. Mirian will use the loan to purchase furniture. Mirian's dream is to have her children graduate and to ensure that her business is the best in the area.

loans.use: purchase wooden furniture

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 43 años, es una mujer  muy  trabajadora, vive  junto a su esposo Hugo de 43 años; viven en su propia casa  y tienen 05 hijos a quienes brinda lo mejor para un buen futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Victoria a logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao y café, productos que luego lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad que gracias a ello logro abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde la gente que habita cerca a ella llegan a comprarle los productos que Victoria vende en su tienda. En adelante, desea incrementar productos de abarrotes para su tienda y así dedicarse a ello mientras que su esposo le ayuda en el cuidado de su chacra. Este es crédito número 05 con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anterior crédito y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles,  podrá comprar productos de abarrotes  como: arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, conservas, entre otros; para que pueda incrementar en su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria, aged 43, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband Hugo, also 43. They live in their own house and have 5 children, to whom they give the best that they can, to offer them a bright future. With a lot of hard graft, Victoria has succeeded in turning their land into production: she grows cocoa and coffee, which she takes to the city of San Francisco to sell at wholesale. Her produce has given them the income they need to maintain themselves and meet the household expenses. For this reason she wants to re-invest what she earns into developing the business further. What she likes best about her work is taking care of the growing crop, which makes her very happy. 

Victoria has been working in this way for 12 years, and because of this she has also succeeded in opening a grocery store, where local people come to buy the items she sells. Going forward, she would like to increase the range of groceries in her shop, and devote her time to running it while her husband helps by taking care of the crops. 

This is Victoria's fifth loan from [field partner] MFP. She has been very punctual with her repayments in the past and expects to remain so now. She participates fully in her communal bank and is always aware of the agreements made by the group. With the 2,000 Soles, Victoria will be able to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, sodas, and canned goods, among other things, so she can increase her shop.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, sodas and canned goods at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariuxi Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mariuxi es socia del banco comunal Los Laureles, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar que de clima frió, en su entorno se encuentran  grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas y viejas haciendas, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de ganado y a la agricultura, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita Mariuxi tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive independiente en una casita arrendada.

Ella es empleada privada desde a hace 6 meses, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga, con su crédito lo va a comprar víveres para su hogar y pagar loa servicios básicos de su casa.
 
Su meta es volver a estudiar y culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Miss Mariuxi is a member of “Los Laureles” (The Laurels) Communal Bank. She lives in the environs of  Cumbe parish, Cuenca. There we find a cold climate and the large pastures of cattle ranches and old haciendas. The people are dedicated to  commerce, cattle raising, and agriculture. They maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.

Mariuxi is 22 years old, single, and lives independently in a rented house. She has been a private employee for the last 6 months, working Sunday to Sunday from 9:00 am until 9:00 at night.

This is Mariuxi's first loan through her communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. With this loan she will buy groceries and pay for basic services for her home. Her goal is to resume studying and complete her university degree.

loans.use: buy groceries and pay for house's basic services, while she resumes studying.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio, de 48 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador; viven en su casa propia con sus 03 hijos; a quienes brinda lo mejor. Aurelio, es un hombre muy responsable y conocedor de su trabajo; es campesino sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde temprana edad,  viene trabajando en su propia chacra hace 07 años y cuenta cultivos de café.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. En adelante, espera comprar abono y productos químicos para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas de café. Este es el crédito número 01 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprará abono y productos químicos para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Aurelio, who is 48 years old, is a very happy and hardworking man; He lives in his own house with his three children, to whom he gives the very best. Aurelio is a very responsible man, well known for his work. He is a farmer. His parents taught him this line of work at a young age. He has been working at his own farmhouse for seven years and now has coffee crops. 

During harvest time, he has the help of day workers. He knows very well that he makes money because of the good quality of his produce. He sells his coffee and cacao products in the city of San Francisco, a place where people offer the best prices for the quality of his beans. 

What he likes best about his job is harvesting the beans, since in doing this he feels like the months of hard work have given him quality produce in return. He thinks the most difficult part is bringing the products from harvest to the point that he can dry them. In the future, he hopes to buy fertilizer and chemical products to maintain his coffee plants. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He feels that the money from the loan will help him greatly in his progress at his job, and he is ready to make his payments according to schedule. He is grateful to the Prisma institution for giving him the loan. With the 1,000 nuevos soles he will buy fertilizer and chemical products to maintain his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemical products.

loans.name: Caciano

texts.es: Caciano, de 28 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa, construido a base de material rustico. Caciano es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y trabaja con mucho esmero para sobresalir adelante con sus plantas de cacao, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de las plagas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en:
Caciano, who is 28 years old, is a hard-working young man. He lives in his own house, which is constructed of rustic materials. Caciano is a young man who is focused on his responsibilities and works with great conscientiousness to excel with his plantings of cacao. After he harvests the cacao, he takes it to the city of San Francisco to sell. There are various buyers there, who, knowing the quality of his products, don't hesitate to wait for him so that they can buy his harvest wholesale. What he likes most about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive. He has been doing this work for five years. He considers the most difficult part of his work to be fumigating his plantings for pests, since he has to do it with great care, because the chemical products cause reactions and he fears for his future health. 

The loan he is applying for is for maintaining his crops. In the future, he hopes to continue saving his income, because he wants to buy new fields. This will be his first loan from MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for the development of his work. He feels happy to belong the group of members of his communal bank. With the 1000 PEN, he will hire day workers so that they can help him in the maintenance of his fields, for example, by pruning, clearing, and fumigating.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Francisca Del Rosario

texts.es:
De oficio agricultora, originaria de Chacaraseca una pequeña comarca de León,  es Francisca de 52 años de edad, casada, madre de 4 hijos todos ellos viven aparte. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y también trabaja en la siembra. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes la criaron en el campo trabajando desde muy pequeña y con esos le ha servido a ella para salir adelante con su hijos. Hoy en día ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.  
Ella solicita el crédito para compra de dos vacas paridas . Pues las utilizara para vender leche producto que es muy solicitado en su comunidad. A ella le gusta mucho el campo conoce muy bien las actividades una de sus  planes es tener una granja de cerdos y comprar ganado de raza.
texts.en: Francisca makes a living in agriculture and is a native of Chacaraseca, a small area in León. She is 52 years old, married and has four children who all live on their own. She makes a living raising pigs and chickens and also works in the fields. She learned the trade from her parents, who raised her on a farm and had her working since she was very young. That knowledge has helped her make headway for her family. Today, she and her husband have crops and raise livestock. She is requesting the loan to purchase two young cows so she can sell their milk, which is in high demand in her community. Francisca really likes working in the field because she knows it very well. One of her plans is to have a pig farm and buy cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two young cows.

loans.name: Cleta

texts.es:
Cleta, de 47 años es una mujer alegre y laboriosa, esta casada con Odilon de 50 años y fruto de esa relación tienen 02 hijos Guísela de 16 años y Niker de 09 y juntos viven en su propia casa. Cleta, empezó su aventura como agricultora desde muy niña en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro le llevo a adquirir sus propias tierras, comprados con el esfuerzo de su  esposo y de si misma; viene trabajando 40 años en su propia parcela; en la cual  cultiva plantas de cacao. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su trabajo. Se siente muy comprometida con su labor; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de producto vendido. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es crédito numero 03 con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por poner orden al grupo.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprara plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Cleta, 47, is a very happy and hard-working woman. She is married to Odilon, 50, with whom she has two children: Guísela, 16, and Niker, 9. They all live together in their own home. Cleta starting working in agriculture when she was very young, working on her parents' land. Her passion for farming brought her to acquire her own land, a purchase thanks to the efforts of herself and her husband, and she has been working on her own farm for nearly 40 years, cultivating cocoa. During the harvest season she counts on day laborers who pick the products quickly so she can reap the benefits faster. She feels very fulfilled with her work because she has seen her daily efforts bear fruit, earning good profits for every kilogram she sells. She is requesting the loan to acquire cocoa plants to graft so her crops will mature in less time. But for now what she wants most is to buy more land to expand her harvest and increase her production. This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time so she can receive more loans in the future. She is a very respected member of her community bank because she brings order to the group.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants to graft.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, Ica, Perú. Nazca es una ciudad cuyos pobladores son muy generosos y hospitalarios, tiene un legado en cuanto a cultura, como peruanos estamos muy orgullosos de esta ciudad ya que alberga las líneas de nazca, estas han sido dibujadas en un extenso campo y que eran utilizadas por la cultura Nazca para la agricultura ya que eran una especie de calendario en donde ellos podían saber cuando era la época de lluvia, debido a estas majestuosas líneas esta ciudad alberga cada año infinidad de turistas, Marcial solo estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económico pero a el le hubiera gustado estudiar música en un centro o escuela especializada ya que la música es su vida y su herramienta de trabajo.

Marcial es un ejemplo de lucha un ejemplo de que cuando uno quiere salir adelante pase lo que pase se puede conseguir, Marcial hace unos años sufrió un duro accidente, el se dedica a la música, y en unos de esos viajes sufrió el accidente, el viajaba con su esposa , la cual perdió la vida y el prácticamente perdió la vista ya que actualmente no puede ver muy bien; a raíz de ello el quedo viudo, y al cuidado de su hijo, el cual ha sacado adelante a pesar de la adversidad; ello nos demuestra que aveces no nos damos cuenta de que hay personas que necesitan mas ayuda que nosotros y con esfurzo y dedicacion y sobre todo amor por la vida lo hacen; el lucha todos los días sin que el cansancio lo doblegue.

Actualmente se dedica a su negocio de música , el cual consiste en hacer composiciones musicales en especial de la música folclórica de nuestro país, y asimismo presentarse en eventos, conciertos que se realizan en su ciudad ya que lo hace muy bien ,a pesar de la discapacidad con su vista, el viaja a diversos lugares de su ciudad para presentarse en conciertos y lo hace al lago de su fiel compañero, amigo y mano derecha que es su hijo	y por el cual él es capaz de dar la vida y luchar contra todo y contra todos por verlo feliz. Marcial trabaja alrededor de 15 horas semanales ya que depende de los eventos que se realizan, los cuales  casi siempre con los fines de semana, el puede ganar hasta s/. 700 en una semana y cuando es una semana buena puede ganar hasta S/.1,500, el nos comenta que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios siempre está a su lado todos los días, en especial en el momento de su accidente ya que el está vivo y puedo cuidar de su hijo que en ese entonces era muy pequeño, y también porque a pesar de no ver bien toca la música con sentimiento y por ello lo hace muy bonito, así también es cumplido con sus clientes y lo recomiendan mucho por su buen trabajo y puntualidad.

El agradece a Dios y a los prestatarios Kiva por la ayuda que ha recibido ya que gracias a ello podrá realizar un videoclip publicitario para llevarlo a las televisoras del nuestro país Perú, con ello el lograra que lo conozcan a nivel nacional y tener más conciertos por mes para así tener más ingresos para seguir ahorrando y poder lograr su sueño: Viajar al País de Cuba para que lo puedan operar y poder recuperar su vista y seguir luchando por la vida y sobre todo para ver a su hijo hecho un profesional y que se sienta orgulloso de él”
texts.en:
Marcial is 35 years old and lives in the city of Nazca, Ica, Peru. Nazca is a city whose inhabitants are very generous and hospitable. It has a cultural heritage: as Peruvians, we are very proud of this city since it has the Nazca Lines. They were drawn over extensive fields and were used by the Nazca culture in its agriculture; they are a type of calendar whereby one could determine when the rainy season might arrive. Because of these majestic lines, the city welcomes an infinity of tourists every year. 

Marcial only studied up to the 6th grade of primary. His parents had few economic resources. He would have liked to study music in a center or specialized school, since music is his life and his work tool. 

Marcial is an example of struggle, evidence that when one desires to get ahead, come what may, it can be achieved. Some years ago, Marcial suffered a terrible accident while traveling with his wife. She lost her life and he nearly became blind; he still has very poor vision. As a result, he was left a widower with a son to care for but he has advanced despite adversity. This demonstrates that, at times, we lack awareness that there are people who need more help than we do. With effort and dedication, and especially, much love of life, he struggles every day without tiring or giving up.

At present, Marcial is committed to the music business, composing, especially, Peruvian folkloric music. He also performs his music at events and concerts which he presents throughout his city, which he does very well, despite his limited vision. He travels to diverse parts of the city to give his concerts, and does so alongside his faithful companion, friend and right hand, his son, who would give his life and struggle against all and everyone, to see his father happy. Marcial works around 15 hours a week, depending on how many events he schedules. They usually occur on weekends. Marcial earns around 700 new sols a week and in a good week he can earn up to 1,500 new sols. He comments that his business is doing well because God is on his side every day, as He was at the time of the accident, since Marcial is alive and can care for his son who at that time was very small; also because despite not seeing very well, he can play music with feeling and, therefore, very beautifully. Also, he is much appreciated by his clients and they often recommend him owing to his good work and punctuality.

Marcial gives thanks to God and to Kiva investors for the help he has received, since thanks to them, he can now make a publicity video to deliver to Peru's TV networks. With that, he will become known at the national level and give more monthly concerts and earn more income, enabling him to continue saving to achieve his dream: to travel to Cuba for an operation to recover his sight, then continue struggling for a good life and, most of all, to see his son become a professional that he can be proud of.

loans.use: to make a publicity video to promote his musical career.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She resides in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Merlinda owns and operates a retail store, selling clothing in the local community.  She has been in this business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Merlinda is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merlinda hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Doris Sonia

texts.es:
Doris Sonia es muy alegre y a pesar de las adversidades ella logra tener un buen semblante y no se amilana ante nada, ella es madre de 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 6, 17,19 años de edad el menor  cursa el primer año de educación secundaria, y los dos mayores estudian en la universidad, a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo; a Doris le encanta preparar dulces y cocinar en sus tiempos libres, por ello siempre prepara su palto favorito el cual es el “Arroz con pollo”, ella nos comenta que sus hijos aman su manera; es por ello que le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía, pero debido a los pocos recursos económicos con los que contaban sus padres no lo pudo hacer, por ello ella lucha cada día porque sus hijos sean profesionales y no descansara hasta lograrlo.

Doris actualmente tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ropa y bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, labora alrededor de 12 horas diarias y atiende de 15 a 20 clientes en el día, puede ganar hasta S/.40 y en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.60, ella cree que su negocio tiene buena acogida gracias a que brinda una buena atención a sus clientes.

Doris agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes, ropa por pedido)y con ello tener mas variedad en sus productos tendra mayores ingresos y con ello seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su mas anhelado sueño: “Hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales de Éxito y mejorar su calidad de vida.”
texts.en:
Doris Sonia is very happy, and in spite of the adversities, she succeeds in putting on a good face and is not afraid of anything. She is the mother of three children, whose ages are 6, 17, and 19. The youngest is in the first year of education. The two oldest, whom she has raised with much effort, study at the university. Doris likes to prepare sweets and cook in her free time. For that reason, she always prepares her favorite dish, which is "chicken with rice." She tells us that her children love her way of cooking. For that reason, she would have liked to study gastronomy, but because of her parents' limited economic resources, she was not able to do it. Thus she struggles every day so that her children can have careers, and she won't rest until this is achieved.

Doris now has her own business where she sells groceries, clothing, soft drinks, and beer. She works about 12 hours every day and waits on 15 to 20 customers in a day. She can earn up to 40 PEN, and on a very good day she can earn up to 60 PEN. She believes that her business does well because she offers good service to her customers. 

Doris is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (groceries and sample clothing for ordering), and with it she will have a greater variety of products and greater income, so that she can continue saving to be able to fulfill her most desired dream: to have her children have successful careers and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries and clothing) for her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

Helen owns and operates a business venture selling ice cream in the local community to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business. 

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Helen wants to expand her ice cream business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a married woman who has two children. Anabelle is 40 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Anabelle sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living and she has been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Anabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with five children. Maria is 55 years old, residing at Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Maria plants and harvests corn for sale to earn a living and she has been four years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In the future, Maria wants to improve her living and to own a car.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. Marlyn is 32 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She used her last loan to purchase pesticides for banana growing. Now, Marlyn is busy with her pigs business. She requested a new loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She hopes to expand her new business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. She is 32 years old, is married and has three children. 

Loren owns and operates a gardening business to earn for a living. She has been in her business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Loren joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Loren is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Joseph Senen

texts.en:
Joseph Senen is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Joseph Senen is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Joseph Senen owns and operates a piggery business, breeding and selling pigs. Joseph Senen has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Joseph Senen is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase sacks of feed for pigs. 

In 2010, Joseph Senen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

In the future, Joseph Senen plans to have his own car and to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen, age 42, lives with her husband and six children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. 

She cultivates rice crops and takes some time to sell fresh fish in a local market for her livelihood. She earns approximately $1.50 per day to cover her daily expenses.
 
This is her second loan from Kiva and forth loan from HKL. Pen would like to borrow this loan to build a store and start selling groceries in her neighborhood. And with the remaining funds, she will buy a pair of tires for her plowing machine. 

She hopes that she will be able to improve her business and lead her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to build a store and start selling groceries in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old and married. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Susan sells ice cream in the local community to earn a living and she has been six years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. 

In 2010, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Susan wants to expand her ice cream business and to buy more ice cream carts.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Annabella is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Annabella is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Annabella runs a general store. Annabella has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Annabella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Annabella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with five children. Gloria is 61 years old, residing at Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Gloria plants and harvests bananas and coconuts for sale to earn a living, and she has been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She is 38 years of age, married and has one school-age child. Her husband is a good farmer. 

Josephine has established a small business to help her husband earn income. She raises pigs for sale.
 
Josephine sells her pigs to her contract buyer. Josephine had been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month. This is her primary source of income.

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011 to access financial services to help her business. She has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed for the good growth and nourishment of her pigs. This is her second loan taken from GDMPC.

Josephine's revenue will be reinvested back to the business to double the return, and a portion of the profit will be used for the family and for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 33 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Charity used her last loan to purchase adequate supplies to prepare food. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to purchase new items to expand product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Fua

texts.en:
Fua is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Fua owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Fua has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 800 WST a month ( approximately 350 USD) from these activities.

In 2011, Fua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fua requested a new loan of 1000 WST from SPBD which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Fua plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman with four children. Amelita is 49 years old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. 

To make a living, Amelita  owns and operates a business venture, providing beauty services to local community members. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide her service. 

In 2009, Amelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Amelita hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Mrs. Svay has been living and raising some piglets in Baray district. Besides her pig-fattening business, Svay is also involved in selling fish in a local market of the province to make additional income. She typically earns around $3.20 per day through her businesses. She now has three single children who are attending school and are under her care. 

Mrs. Svay is taking out a loan from lenders to purchase extra piglets, around 10 of them, to sustain her pig-raising business. And with any balance of the loan, she will buy potatoes in bulk from the villagers for future sale. In the future, Mrs. Svay wishes to own a potato plantation herself.

loans.use: to purchase extra piglets and to buy potatoes in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Simamao

texts.en:
Simamao is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa.  She is married and has five adult children.  To make a living, Simamao owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting coconuts for sale.  Simamao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 600 WST (approximately 280 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Simamao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simamao requested her first loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.    Simamao plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria, 60, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, her business partner and father to her child. She and her husband together manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gliceria hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.en:
Lisbeth is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Lisbeth is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Lisbeth owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been in her business for four years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Lisbeth is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. In 2010, Lisbeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
Maylin is married, 44 years of age, and blessed with four children. She is from the simple village of Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is cultivating a corn farm. Maylin decided herself to create a business to help her husband in finding a source of income for the family.

Maylin is operating a service-based business specializing in picture-laminating. She has been in this business for thirteen years. Having this kind of business is of great help to the family. The return of income is excellent. She has monthly earnings in the amount of 5,000 PHP. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2007 to gain financial access to help her engage in business activities. Recently, she came to GDMPC and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy supplementary materials for picture-laminating. Josephine is in her seventh loan cycle. Her loan record is superb. 

Maylin’s future plan is to have her own space or shop for her business and not to rent any more.

loans.use: to purchase laminating materials.

loans.name: Leyerlita

texts.en:
This is Leyerlita, 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Pedrito, a construction worker. She is also mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leyerlita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Leyerlita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna, 41, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Arbi, a mechanic. She is also mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 32,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lorna hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and does not have any children. To make a living, Luisa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $250 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Luisa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Luisa  requested her first loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Luisa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Sharel

texts.en:
Sharel is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sharel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector: she runs a general store. Although it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Sharel has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 750 Samoa talas (WST) a month (approximately $350 USD) from these activities.

In 2011, Sharel joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and for the ability to engage in business activities. Sharel is requesting her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. Sharel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Kimberly is a 19-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Kimberly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Although this is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. Kimberly has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 450 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $280 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Kimberly joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Kimberly requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase chemicals such as Gramoxome. The loan will be the first loan taken out by Kimberly from SPBD. Kimberly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals such as gramoxome.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vasati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing shirt making services to local community members. Vasati has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 800 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $400 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Vasati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to gain the ability to engage in business activities.      Vasati requested her first loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Vasati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen is 52 years old and a responsible mother of 4 children, living in Baray district. Pen, as well as other villagers, has been in the business of growing crops throughout the years. She grows rice, a kind of bean, and peanuts, earning in the neighborhood of $1.60 per day. She has been involved in this business for years alongside her husband. At the same time, Pen has also been operating a retail business in a local market. She sells fresh fish, which are caught from the Tonle Sap River by her husband.

At the present, she is looking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase rice and peanut seeds and mineral fertilizers for her farming process. Pen aims to expand her present house in the coming years when she has enough funds and improve her agricultural business successfully with a high rate of output.

loans.use: To purchase rice and peanut seeds and mineral fertilizers for her farming process.

loans.name: 030813-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to to purchase fish and shrimp to resell. Thủy is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Thủy is the leader of a six-member group, the 030813-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: Talaofia

texts.en:
Talaotia is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Talaotia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. She raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Talaotia has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 400 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $220 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Talaotia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities.  Talaotia requested her first loan of 1000 Samoa talas (WST) from SPBD, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Talaotia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: 030711-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

Hồng is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 030711-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hồng hopes to buy land of her own, to travel for vacation within the country, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: To purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: 030814-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future. Liên has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Liên is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 030814-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Solidarity Group. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa.  She is married and has eight adult-aged children.

To make a living, Kalameli owns and operates an agriculture sector business venture, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Kalameli has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 WST (approximately 300 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Kalameli joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Kalameli requested her first SPBD loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Kalameli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.en:
Alfonso is from Barangay, Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental. He is married and blessed with seven children. Alfonso is 66 years of age. His wife is a housewife who takes care of the children.

Alfonso is in the agricultural business, taking cared of a boar/male swine. People in the community request his male boar for breeding purposes. Subsequently, when the female boar gives birth in four months, Alfonso gets one of the piglets as his share.   

Alfonso raises the piglets he gets  from his male boar used for breeding. He raises them for sale to earn a living.  He has been in this business for over 10 years and earns 6,400PHP a month. Alfonso plans to expand his business because it gives him a good income. 

Alfonso joined GDMPC in 2008 to gain financial access. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000PHP to purchase pig feed.

Alfonso's plan for the future is to be able to purchase additional male swine to use for breeding.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 48, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nicomedes, an overseas contract worker, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband  manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Wilma operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Wilma is requesting a PHP26, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Wilma hopes to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for computer parts and accessories needed in her business

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Lalo Nonu.  She is married and has 4 adult -age children.  To make a living, Faalupega owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faalupega has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 200 WST ( approximately 100USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Faalupega joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faalupega has requested her first loan of 1000 WST from SPBD which will be used to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome. Faalupega plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the  business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals such as gramoxome

loans.name: 030815-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She lives and works in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.  Thủy has a manufacturing business sewing clothing. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth for her business. 

In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 030815-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thủy hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sewing clothing.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 50, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a motorcycle mechanic. 

Lien supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business thirteen years ago. She sells snacks, biscuits, soft drinks, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rose operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals during the evening when all  family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Rose's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rose is requesting a loan for 16,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rose dreams of giving her her children a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lam and his wife have been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of their house for many years. They sell noodles. 

He would like to borrow money to expand his business by buying plates, bowls, and furniture. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy plates, bowls and furniture

loans.name: Asoitupu

texts.en:
Asoitupu is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Asoitupu grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Asoitupu has been engaged in this business for more than one year and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Asoitupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Asoitupu requested her first loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Asoitupu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 54 and has two daughters. Her husband earns an income working as a refrigeration maintenance worker.

She has been earning a living by operating a store from the door of her house for the past three years. She sells a variety of soft drinks and fruit juice. 

Luan would like to borrow money to expand her current business by buying additional fruit and soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung, 34, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He and his wife have supported his family by running a mechanical shop at his house for eleven years. They make screws. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials for his metal shop

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 42, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, an Aircon technician, and mother of two children. By the grace of God, Merlita has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Merlita operates a business selling sugar. What she basically does is buy sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repack them and sell them per kilo to individuals, general store owners, and the local community. Sugar is repacked in ¼, 1/2, and 1 kilo packages. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more sugar to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merlita dreams to be able to give all of her children a high quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and to draw strength and inspiration from her study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is 42 years old, married, and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have supported their family by running a mechanical shop at their house for 12 years. They make screws. 

Ngan is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by buying equipment and materials to better satisfy her customers.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and materials for her metal shop.
